Company DescriptionFounded in 1960, Domino’s Pizza is the largest pizza company in the world, with a significant business in both delivery and carryout pizza. It ranks among the world’s top public restaurant brands with a global enterprise of more than 19,500 stores in over 90 markets. Domino’s had global retail sales of nearly $17.8 billion in 2021, with over $8.6 billion in the U.S. and over $9.1 billion internationally. In the third quarter of 2022, Domino’s had global retail sales of over $4.0 billion, with over $2.0 billion in the U.S. and nearly $2.0 billion internationally. Its system is comprised of independent franchise owners who accounted for 98% of Domino’s global stores as of the end of the third quarter of 2022. Emphasis on technology innovation helped Domino’s achieve more than half of all global retail sales in 2021 from digital channels. In the U.S., Domino’s generated more than 75% of U.S. retail sales in 2021 via digital channels and has developed several innovative ordering platforms, including those for Google Home, Facebook Messenger, Apple Watch, Amazon Echo, Twitter and more.Job DescriptionThe International Business Director (IBD) plays a critical role in the global system as the overall relationship owner across their assigned portfolio for a range of markets from the newly formed DRG+ Europe region. This position is accountable for delivering Domino’s annual budget targets for net store openings and same store sales growth for their designated portfolio. Additionally, they are responsible for ensuring their Master Franchisees are compliant with their Master Franchise Agreement (MFA) and are sufficiently capitalized to run successful operations and deliver sustainable, profitable, growth. To accomplish these objectives, the IBD must closely coordinate with all Centers of Excellence (COE) to effectively influence our Master Franchisee partners.RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:(50%) Deliver Domino’s annual budget targets through impactful consulting:Accountable for delivering Domino’s annual budget targets for net store openings and same store sales growth for their designated portfolio.Partner with the COEs to develop tailored annual operating plans that deliver the appropriate level of support and impact to the Master Franchisee or markets based on the segmentation model (Focus, Consult, Protect).Effectively influence Master Franchisees’ or markets’ annual and strategic plans to drive sustainable, profitable, growth. Conduct regular business reviews with all markets, leveraging the business assessment tool to identify opportunities.Share Domino’s best practices across all key disciplines.Support the optimization of our portfolio of Master Franchisees to help create economies of scale and maximize our long-term store and sales growth potential.(20%) Ensure compliance with the Master Franchise Agreement and protect the brand:Embrace our franchisor role ensuring all assigned markets and Master Franchisees are in full compliance of our MFA. Company DescriptionFounded in 1960, Domino’s Pizza is the largest pizza company in the world, with a significant business in both delivery and carryout pizza. It ranks among the world’s top public restaurant brands with a global enterprise of more than 19,500 stores in over 90 markets. Domino’s had global retail sales of nearly $17.8 billion in 2021, with over $8.6 billion in the U.S. and over $9.1 billion internationally. In the third quarter of 2022, Domino’s had global retail sales of over $4.0 billion, with over $2.0 billion in the U.S. and nearly $2.0 billion internationally. Its system is comprised of independent franchise owners who accounted for 98% of Domino’s global stores as of the end of the third quarter of 2022. Emphasis on technology innovation helped Domino’s achieve more than half of all global retail sales in 2021 from digital channels. In the U.S., Domino’s generated more than 75% of U.S. retail sales in 2021 via digital channels and has developed several innovative ordering platforms, including those for Google Home, Facebook Messenger, Apple Watch, Amazon Echo, Twitter and more.Job DescriptionThe International Business Director (IBD) plays a critical role in the global system as the overall relationship owner across their assigned portfolio. This position is accountable for delivering Domino’s annual budget targets for net store openings and same store sales growth for their designated portfolio. Additionally, they are responsible for ensuring their Master Franchisees are compliant with their Master Franchise Agreement (MFA) and are sufficiently capitalized to run successful operations and deliver sustainable, profitable, growth. Put plans in place to address any gaps in compliance.Ensure all changes to standards and policies and communicated in a timely manner to Master Franchisees.Closely partner with the QA team to support the implementation of the overall global food safety agenda at the assigned markets to protect the consumers we serve, and the Domino’s brand.Confirm that the Master Franchisees’ capital structure, balance sheet and store-level economics are sufficient to deliver long-term, sustainable, growth. If deficiencies are identified in one of these areas, partner with the Master Franchisees to develop the appropriate action plans. Participation in this program requires that you are located in France or Netherlands for the duration of the engagement.To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on the resume.(France): Google welcomes people with disabilities.Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Paris, France; Amsterdam, Netherlands; Grenoble, France.Minimum qualifications:Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, or related technical field.Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, etc.).Preferred qualifications:Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.Experience as a researcher (e.g., internships, full-time, or at a lab).Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, etc.).Experience with contributing to research communities or efforts, (e.g., publishing papers in conferences or journals).Ability to speak and write in English fluently.About The JobThe Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on research projects.The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for flexibility beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don't always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.ResponsibilitiesParticipate in research to develop solutions for problems.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form . Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Als Junior Back-end Developer bent verantwoordelijk voor het succesvol ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en implementeren van applicaties voor de Payter producten. Je specificeert, ontwerpt, ontwikkelt, realiseert en test (sub)systemen binnen de grenzen van systeemspecificaties, kosten en projectplanning. Je werkt samen met andere disciplines en leveranciers voor een tijdige realisatie van concurrerende, uitvoerbare en duurzame producten. Je draagt bij aan de algemene verbreding en het onderhoud van de technologische basis van Payter.ResponsibilitiesJe ontwikkelt the back-end van de website applicaties;Je ontwerpt en ontwikkelt API’s;Je zorgt dat onze klanten op alle devices en omgevingen een smooth werkendeen shiney ogende applicatie zien;Je brengt de technische kant samen met de eisen van de organisatie;Je weet wat er speelt en blijft bij op het gebied van web apps en programmeertalen.RequirementsJe hebt minimaal een Bachelor-diploma;2+ jaar werk ervaring;Je bent bekend met agile werken;Je hebt ervaring met HTML, CSS;Je beheerst Java (vereist);Je bent bekend met databases als PostgreSQL;Je bent bekend met Elasticsearch, kubernetes en GCP;Je bent bekend met Google cloud, Kafka;Je hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden zowel mondeling als schriftelijk;Je hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen en oog voor detail.BenefitsConcurrerend salaris tussen €3000 - €3200 per maand;25 dagen jaarlijks verlof + feestdagen + 1 betaalde vrije dag per maand;Een uitdagende functie met afwisselend werk in een dynamische omgeving;Werken in een succesvolle, jonge, groeiende internationale organisatie;Een werkomgeving waarbij kwaliteit en service hoog in het vaandel staan;Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden en een leuke werksfeer met gezamenlijke lunch;Een mooi kantoor op 10 minuten lopen van station Melanchtonweg en Rotterdam-Noord. What does the job entail?As an Application Manager, you will be part of our IT Support department and be the first point of contact for all your colleagues with IT-related questions. You handle all workstations, our complete application landscape, which consists of applications such as: Office 365, Salesforce, Monday and Business Central. This makes you an important link in the on- and offboarding process. Naturally, as a true IT guru, you will try to automate your tasks as much as possible. People will reach out to you with questions about their devices and the applications that they are using. You will make sure that everybody will be fully equipped to properly perform their job. This also requires a high level of integrity, as you will be an administrator of many sensitive systems, and you are responsible for the company-wide authorization process.Some things you are working on:User and authorization management Device management Network management Periodic checking of access rights (according to ISO27001 standard) Prioritizing and implementing user requirements for critical applications Documenting processes and solutions Setting up SSO integrations Keeping track of and responding to technical developments Creating smart solutions to make processes even more efficient Who’s GoodHabitzWe're an international Ed-tech company with a mission: make learning accessible, engaging and fun for everyone, by offering online training courses that help people become the best version of themselves. We love to combine fun with growth. That’s obvious from our online training courses, but it’s even more apparent in our working environment. We always look on the bright side and welcome any challenge coming our way. With our eyes on the prize, we are not all work and no fun. Quite the opposite, we invest in fun trips and events to empower our people to have the best time of their lives. We are a team of focused players where mutual inspiration and support are key. We encourage each other, we love personal development, celebrating successes, and our drive connects us.RequirementsWill you be our new colleague?You are helpful by nature. You are someone with a real service heart with a strong love for IT.Others would describe you as a real go-getter, innovative with great communicative skills, with integrity, who is accurate and well-structured. You are a problem-solving thinker andwell-versed in administration. And last but certainly not least, you take pride in the work you do, and you have a positive mindset. How nice would it be to use your IT knowledge and enthusiasm to help your own colleagues!You also have:Minimum experience of 2 years in a similar role as Application Manager, but most importantly you are eager to learn You are resident in the NetherlandsFluent in English. Because we're an international company with colleaugues all over the world.Amazing if you have experience with the apps, we use such as: Salesforce, Business Central, Monday, Office 365, Azure, and Google Cloud. BenefitsOur offerYou will contribute to making online learning a good habit, and you will do this amidst an inspiring group of colleagues within an amazing new office the Bunkertoren. It goes without saying that you will get unlimited access to our online training courses. You get to keep developing yourself; And there's more:✔ A salary that makes you smile✔ 25 paid holidays. Not enough? You can buy up to 10 more✔ Jaw dropping team building and company events✔ Apple equipment and tools so you can work like a pro✔ Travel allowance✔ Mental Coaching via our partner OpenUp;Today is a good day to upgrade yourselfReading all the above with a smile on your face? You know what that means. Take that first step and apply for this job as an Application Manager at GoodHabitz. We can’t wait to get to know you – quirks and all!Do you want to know what makes us special? Or do you have other burning questions before you apply? Feel free to contact our Recruitment team. You can get a hold of them by sending an email to recruitment@goodhabitz.com.Applying is easy as pie:✔ Share your enthusiasm and resume✔ Get a reply from us within 5 working daysOur selection process in a nutshell.We aim to run the complete recruitment process in 2 weeks with 3 interviews before we know if there is a match in both ways. We are looking for two enthusiastic, energetic interns to join our small marketing, events and communications team. Company DescriptionFounded in 1960, Domino’s Pizza is the largest pizza company in the world, with a significant business in both delivery and carryout pizza. It ranks among the world’s top public restaurant brands with a global enterprise of more than 19,500 stores in over 90 markets. Domino’s had global retail sales of nearly $17.8 billion in 2021, with over $8.6 billion in the U.S. and over $9.1 billion internationally. In the third quarter of 2022, Domino’s had global retail sales of over $4.0 billion, with over $2.0 billion in the U.S. and nearly $2.0 billion internationally. Its system is comprised of independent franchise owners who accounted for 98% of Domino’s global stores as of the end of the third quarter of 2022. Emphasis on technology innovation helped Domino’s achieve more than half of all global retail sales in 2021 from digital channels. In the U.S., Domino’s generated more than 75% of U.S. retail sales in 2021 via digital channels and has developed several innovative ordering platforms, including those for Google Home, Facebook Messenger, Apple Watch, Amazon Echo, Twitter and more.Job DescriptionThe International Business Director (IBD) plays a critical role in the global system as the overall relationship owner across their assigned portfolio for a range of markets from the newly formed DRG+ Europe region. This position is accountable for delivering Domino’s annual budget targets for net store openings and same store sales growth for their designated portfolio. Additionally, they are responsible for ensuring their Master Franchisees are compliant with their Master Franchise Agreement (MFA) and are sufficiently capitalized to run successful operations and deliver sustainable, profitable, growth. To accomplish these objectives, the IBD must closely coordinate with all Centers of Excellence (COE) to effectively influence our Master Franchisee partners.RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:(50%) Deliver Domino’s annual budget targets through impactful consulting:Accountable for delivering Domino’s annual budget targets for net store openings and same store sales growth for their designated portfolio.Partner with the COEs to develop tailored annual operating plans that deliver the appropriate level of support and impact to the Master Franchisee or markets based on the segmentation model (Focus, Consult, Protect).Effectively influence Master Franchisees’ or markets’ annual and strategic plans to drive sustainable, profitable, growth. Conduct regular business reviews with all markets, leveraging the business assessment tool to identify opportunities.Share Domino’s best practices across all key disciplines.Support the optimization of our portfolio of Master Franchisees to help create economies of scale and maximize our long-term store and sales growth potential.(20%) Ensure compliance with the Master Franchise Agreement and protect the brand:Embrace our franchisor role ensuring all assigned markets and Master Franchisees are in full compliance of our MFA. Put plans in place to address any gaps in compliance.Ensure all changes to standards and policies and communicated in a timely manner to Master Franchisees.Closely partner with the QA team to support the implementation of the overall global food safety agenda at the assigned markets to protect the consumers we serve, and the Domino’s brand.Confirm that the Master Franchisees’ capital structure, balance sheet and store-level economics are sufficient to deliver long-term, sustainable, growth. If deficiencies are identified in one of these areas, partner with the Master Franchisees to develop the appropriate action plans. Champion new global foundational capabilities (e.g., Cutting Edge Project) to help our Master Franchisees operate more effectively.(20%) Spearhead, or closely support, Domino’s overall relationship with Master Franchisees:Ensure there is a strong working relationship between Domino’s and their Master Franchisees, by making sure there is comprehensive information sharing and that key constituents are consistently engaging with our Business Consultants or COEs.Coordinate, edit, and frequently create content for, all communications and engagements from DPZ and the COEs to the Master Franchisees or markets.Ensure Master Franchisee or market leadership is clear on Domino’s annual and 2030 objectives, including key global initiatives (e.g., voice of the customer). (10%) Lead, coach, and develop a high-performing team:Recruit International Business Managers that are a fit with Domino’s and possess the skills to effectively partner with Master Franchisees and COEs.Promote our company values, leading by example, and encouraging their team to live these values every day.Lead, coach and motivate their team to create an open inclusive environment where all team members can bring their ideas and whole self to work.Foster a highly collaborative culture that facilitates a strong partnership with all COEs.Provide constructive feedback on a regular basis and create detailed action plans during the semi-annual performance appraisal process to develop team members’ leadership and functional competencies.Partner with RVPs to create career development plans for all team members.QualificationsBachelor’s Degree with 10+ years of Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) experience.Possesses a robust and broad general management skillset, with an emphasis on retail operations and financial acumen.Strong verbal and written communication skills, with a proven track record of communicating effectively with C-suite level executives.An advanced consultative skillset that leverages strong problem solving and analytical competencies to effectively persuade senior leaders to act.Demonstrated ability to develop and grow influential and collaborative relationships with both external and internal partners.Experienced in leading high-performance teams in a matrixed organization.Work experience outside of the U.S. preferred.Multilingual and multicultural skills preferred.Ability to travel internationally 50% of the time. YOU WORK FOR WEAls Data Analist heb jij de uitdaging om onze klantbeleving te verbeteren door het vertalen van het online en in-store gedrag en data van onze members naar relevante inzichten en verbeteracties. Op deze manier help jij onze E-Commerce, Retail, Marketing en Product teams, want jij weet bijvoorbeeld precies welke klanten we moeten aanspreken om onze business verder te laten groeien. Vanuit de klantinzichten die jij creëert optimaliseren we onze member-acquisitie en bedienen we onze klanten nog persoonlijker op maat. Ook draag je bij aan het ontwikkelen en implementeren van de juiste analytische oplossingen, dashboards en rapportages. Daarnaast werk je nauw samen met twee andere Analisten in het E-Commerce team. Samen verdiepen jullie je in de verschillende databronnen, die de basis zijn van onze data-driven strategie, om complexe organisatievraagstukken te beantwoorden. En het leukste van alles? Jouw pro-activiteit, concrete adviezen en inzichten in onze resultaten, gekoppeld aan KPI’s, leveren een directe bijdrage aan de commerciële doorontwikkeling van onze business! Ken jij onze klanten binnenkort als geen ander?Wat we van jou verwachten?WO werk- en denkniveau en een afgeronde opleiding in bijvoorbeeld Marketing, Economie of Bedrijfskunde.Circa 3 tot 4 jaar relevante werkervaring in E-Commerce/Digital. Retail- en Fashionervaring zijn een pre.Excel en SQL ken je als geen ander en ervaring met Google Analytics en Microstrategy is een pre.Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig, proactief en een sterke adviseur die inzichten kan vertalen naar concrete- en direct uitvoerbare acties. Wij evalueren alle sollicitanten op basis van competenties, ervaring en equal pay m/v/x.WE WORK FOR YOUJe Krijgt Daarom Van OnsJij zorgt er met jouw analytische skills dagelijks voor dat we kunnen blijven groeien met onze e-commerce business, dus daar mag ook wat tegenover staan. You work for WE, WE work for you.Een salaris dat past bij jouw kennis, opleiding en ervaring.Een laptop, zodat je hybride kan werken. Dus of je nou thuis (inclusief thuiswerkvergoeding) of op kantoor wil werken, jij kiest dagelijks de werkplek die bij jou past. En lijkt het je wat om een keer een workation te nemen? Dat kan!Een reiskostenvergoeding, 25 vakantiedagen, 8% vakantiegeld, standaard 20% shopkorting, een pensioenregeling én een uitgebreid pakket aan collectieve verzekeringen.Jaarlijkse “Moments that matter day”; een extra vrije dag die jij mag inzetten op een dag met een speciale betekenis voor jou.Als je 2 jaar bij ons in dienst bent kom je in aanmerking voor een sabbatical van minimaal 8 tot maximaal 16 weken waarbij wij 25% van je salaris doorbetalen.De kans om continu te leren en te ontwikkelen, zowel vakinhoudelijk als persoonlijk. Vanuit onze WE Academy bieden we bijvoorbeeld verschillende opleidings- en trainingsmogelijkheden die jij nodig hebt om bij ons te excelleren.Korting op jouw sportabonnement, deelnemen aan bootcamp en/of bokslessen tegen een gereduceerd tarief en genieten van gratis fruit op ons hoofdkantoor.Teamuitjes, BBQ’s, events en meer!Who We AreAls modeliefhebber ken je WE Fashion natuurlijk allang. Maar wist je ook dat onze online business in razend tempo aan het groeien is? Zo zit onze e-commerce in 6 verschillende landen waarbij er meer dan 1 miljoen orders de deur uitgaan per jaar, bestaat onze Brands WE Loves uit tientallen mooie merken, verkopen we onze fashion met behulp van onze online partners in meer dan 20 landen én hebben we in totaal meer dan 5 miljoen members!Maar daar laten we het niet bij: we blijven dagelijks zoeken naar groeikansen, ook rondom maatschappelijk verantwoord en duurzaam ondernemen. Want WE Care. Daarom liggen ontwikkeling, verbetering en creatie ook nooit stil bij ons. E-commerce bij WE Fashion is dé plek waar jij de kans krijgt om te innoveren en persoonlijk te groeien. Goede ideeën? Laat van je horen en word een trendsetter! Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Als Junior Back-end Developer bent verantwoordelijk voor het succesvol ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en implementeren van applicaties voor de Payter producten. Je specificeert, ontwerpt, ontwikkelt, realiseert en test (sub)systemen binnen de grenzen van systeemspecificaties, kosten en projectplanning. Je werkt samen met andere disciplines en leveranciers voor een tijdige realisatie van concurrerende, uitvoerbare en duurzame producten. Je draagt bij aan de algemene verbreding en het onderhoud van de technologische basis van Payter.ResponsibilitiesJe ontwikkelt the back-end van de website applicaties;Je ontwerpt en ontwikkelt API’s;Je zorgt dat onze klanten op alle devices en omgevingen een smooth werkendeen shiney ogende applicatie zien;Je brengt de technische kant samen met de eisen van de organisatie;Je weet wat er speelt en blijft bij op het gebied van web apps en programmeertalen.RequirementsJe hebt minimaal een Bachelor-diploma;2+ jaar werk ervaring;Je bent bekend met agile werken;Je hebt ervaring met HTML, CSS;Je beheerst Java (vereist);Je bent bekend met databases als PostgreSQL;Je bent bekend met Elasticsearch, kubernetes en GCP;Je bent bekend met Google cloud, Kafka;Je hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden zowel mondeling als schriftelijk;Je hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen en oog voor detail.BenefitsConcurrerend salaris tussen €3000 - €3200 per maand;25 dagen jaarlijks verlof + feestdagen + 1 betaalde vrije dag per maand;Een uitdagende functie met afwisselend werk in een dynamische omgeving;Werken in een succesvolle, jonge, groeiende internationale organisatie;Een werkomgeving waarbij kwaliteit en service hoog in het vaandel staan;Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden en een leuke werksfeer met gezamenlijke lunch;Een mooi kantoor op 10 minuten lopen van station Melanchtonweg en Rotterdam-Noord. DIGITAL MARKETEERPromote movies, concerts and exhibitions with digital marketing.INTK is a young and ambitious studio based in Utrecht, specialized in developing digital strategies for cultural organizations.Our mission is to change how people relate to culture. Forty years ago, very few people sported regularly. Today, many people dedicate several hours a week to sports. Inspired by the changes in the sports sector, we would like to bring a similar shift in the culture sector. Our goal is to encourage people that love culture to engage in cultural activities weekly. For example, we want to help people that love cinema to go to the movies every week.We work with several museums, theaters, cinemas, castles, libraries, festivals, etc. Some of the cultural organizations we work with include, Guggenheim Museum, Stadsschouwburg Utrecht, Film Theater Hilversum, Loevestein Castle, Library Utrecht, Le Guess Who festival, etc.We are looking for a digital marketing aficionado interested in promoting culture. In case you have limited experience with digital marketing, we offer the opportunity to learn while enjoying the benefits of a full-time paid job.WHAT CAN YOU LEARN?We Encourage You To Obtain The Following Google CertificatesGoogle Ads Search Certificate;Google Ads Measurement Certificate;Google Analytics individual qualification.You will learn some of the most advanced project management and communication tools, including:Learn how to plan your week using Asana;Learn how to communicate transparently using Slack.Consider applying to the position Digital Marketing Expert in case you already have experience.YOUR TASKSAt INTK, you will be slowly responsible for all parts of the business. It includes:Digital marketeer: you will start by doing Google Ads campaigns. At a later stage, you might grow into doing Display and Facebook campaigns or any other marketing tasks that the cultural organization requests;Account manager: you are the contact person of at least 20 cultural organizations. You use Google Analytics to write monthly reports.Business developer: every week, you call cultural organizations encouraging them to work with us. You travel around the country to visit cultural organizations;Manager: we will teach you how to be an entrepreneur by sending invoices, publishing vacancies, and eventually managing a team.INTK is one of the leading marketing agencies in the cultural sector. We are ambitious and looking forward to expanding with new ideas and markets. Within a couple of years, your position can grow into more responsibility and completely new tasks.YOU AREInterested in digital marketing and internet technology;You speak natively one of the following languages: Dutch, German, French, Slovenian, Spanish, Catalan, Italian, Finnish, Danish, Swedish, Polish, Portuguese, or Czech.What We OfferFull-time position;Gain experience with digital marketing in the cultural sector;Work with a young international team;Offices at the center of Utrecht;Five weeks holidays (25 days);Salary between € 2,200 and € 2,800 gross per month, based on knowledge and work experience.Perks And Benefits💻 MacBook and 4K External Screen🚂 Free train tickets for commuting or visiting clients✈️ Free airplane tickets for business development abroad☎️ Telephone/internet costs covered to up to 20euros/month🍌 Free healthy snacks🍹 Free drinks on Fridays👵 Flexible pension plan🎓 Learning budget🎭 Free subscription plan for cultural activitiesAre you interested? Participation in this program requires that you are located in France or Netherlands for the duration of the engagement.To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on the resume.(France): Google welcomes people with disabilities.Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Paris, France; Amsterdam, Netherlands; Grenoble, France.Minimum qualifications:Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, or related technical field.Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, etc.).Preferred qualifications:Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.Experience as a researcher (e.g., internships, full-time, or at a lab).Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, etc.).Experience with contributing to research communities or efforts, (e.g., publishing papers in conferences or journals).Ability to speak and write in English fluently.About The JobThe Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on research projects.The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for flexibility beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don't always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.ResponsibilitiesParticipate in research to develop solutions for problems.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form . Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Company DescriptionAbout Avery DennisonAvery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides branding and information labeling solutions, including pressure-sensitive materials, radio-frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, and a variety of converted products and solutions. The company designs and manufactures a wide range of labeling and functional materials that enhance branded packaging, carry or display information that connects the physical and the digital, and improve customers’ product performance. The company serves an array of industries worldwide, including home and personal care, apparel, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive. The company employs approximately 36,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Reported sales in 2022 were $9.0 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.Job DescriptionWe are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Procurement and Planning Specialist to join our team. You will be responsible for managing our procurement and planning activities including developing procurement plans, selecting suppliers, negotiating contracts, managing supplier relationships, and ensuring that materials and supplies are delivered on time and within budget.Responsibilities Develop and maintain procurement plans to ensure that materials and supplies are available when needed Negotiate prices and rates in accordance with company guidelines and standards. Work towards process centralization of purchases and data input in the system Responsible for the development of the production or manufacturing schedule, balancing customer requirements with production efficiency Analyze and plan material requirements by determining the quantity and date materials are needed to ensure optimal inventory levels. Prepare forecasts and analyze trends in manufacturing, sales, distribution, general business conditions, and other related areas. Implement lean concepts and continuous improvements regarding the supply chain, materials management, and logistics systems and processes. Qualifications 1-3 years in Supply Chain roles or related experience in the planning and procurement process Strong analytical, mathematical, organizational, verbal and written communication skills and detail-oriented. Ability to interact with cross-functional groups to define and execute overall requirements. Capacity to perform investigations, prepare full reports and present statistical information in a clear and concise way Ability to design, develop and maintain tables, formulas, graphs, queries and macros in Excel or Google Sheets Excellent understanding of ERP systemsAdditional InformationWho we are! - Our Story:Each of us, Every day! Eight Values. One Team!We understand diversity and equal opportunities as enrichment for our future-oriented work at Avery Dennison. With us, teams are balanced and diverse. Because each of us is unique, and we appreciate bringing together different personalities and talents. Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer. You are interested in knowing more about our Diversity & Inclusion approach? Please go to averydennison.com/en/home/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion.html At Avery Dennison we do what we love, and we love what we do - Just click here, and get us to know even better: Life @ Avery Dennison (linkedin.com/company/avery-dennison/life/emea)Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our Talent Acquisition team via jobs@eu.averydennison.com Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

We are looking for two enthusiastic, energetic interns to join our small marketing, events and communications team. Your role will provide you with a broad range of marketing and communications experience and help you develop your professional skills and competencies. Please note that there are two different internship roles.The candidates will ideally be able to start as soon as possible for a period of 6 months.We do not provide visa sponsorship for internships.Key ResponsibilitiesEvents, production and digital marketing internship:Assistance with logistics, promotion, and partner collaborations for international events (both online and in-person)Supporting with set-up of event registration and production tools Overseeing part of the event-related digital marketing activities (including website, outreach, and social media)Maintaining and assisting in developing event-related web pagesMarketing operations internship:Improving and maintaining the gresb.com website (Wordpress)Supporting the use of Salesforce (CRM) and Pardot (integrated marketing tool)Supporting sales by creating segmentation lists, dashboards, and reports (Salesforce and Google Analytics)Supporting the development of guidance, marketing and sales content for GRESB Assessments Market researchRequirementsYou are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a field related to Business, Marketing, Management, Administration, Communications, Environmental Science and/or Policy; OR:You study Business Economics, Finance, Engineering, Environmental studies or related and are passionate about Sustainability and ESG issues.You have excellent collaboration skills with a high level of proficiency in written and spoken English. Knowledge of other languages is a plus;You are very well organized and detail-oriented, and able to work in a busy, international environment;You have a high degree of comfort using common software packages and online tools (Excel, Word, Powerpoint). Experience using design software/editing tools, Wordpress, CSS, Monday, Canva and Adobe Suite is a plus.You have the ability to work in the Netherlands. BenefitsInvolvement in a dynamic international organization, that has become the leading sustainability benchmark for real estate and infrastructure. Monthly allowance12 paid days offFree, healthy lunch at the GRESB officeFree public transport to and from the GRESB office (in Amsterdam) within the NetherlandsOpportunity to work with a highly talented team in a supportive environment with loads of camaraderie;Autonomy and the chance to take responsibility for tasks from the beginning of your internship;The opportunity to develop your network by being involved with all types of GRESB stakeholders (Investors, fund managers, sustainability consultants and industry bodies); Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

DIGITAL MARKETEERPromote movies, concerts and exhibitions with digital marketing.INTK is a young and ambitious studio based in Utrecht, specialized in developing digital strategies for cultural organizations.Our mission is to change how people relate to culture. Forty years ago, very few people sported regularly. Today, many people dedicate several hours a week to sports. Inspired by the changes in the sports sector, we would like to bring a similar shift in the culture sector. Our goal is to encourage people that love culture to engage in cultural activities weekly. For example, we want to help people that love cinema to go to the movies every week.We work with several museums, theaters, cinemas, castles, libraries, festivals, etc. Some of the cultural organizations we work with include, Guggenheim Museum, Stadsschouwburg Utrecht, Film Theater Hilversum, Loevestein Castle, Library Utrecht, Le Guess Who festival, etc.We are looking for a digital marketing aficionado interested in promoting culture. In case you have limited experience with digital marketing, we offer the opportunity to learn while enjoying the benefits of a full-time paid job.WHAT CAN YOU LEARN?We Encourage You To Obtain The Following Google CertificatesGoogle Ads Search Certificate;Google Ads Measurement Certificate;Google Analytics individual qualification.You will learn some of the most advanced project management and communication tools, including:Learn how to plan your week using Asana;Learn how to communicate transparently using Slack.Consider applying to the position Digital Marketing Expert in case you already have experience.YOUR TASKSAt INTK, you will be slowly responsible for all parts of the business. It includes:Digital marketeer: you will start by doing Google Ads campaigns. At a later stage, you might grow into doing Display and Facebook campaigns or any other marketing tasks that the cultural organization requests;Account manager: you are the contact person of at least 20 cultural organizations. You use Google Analytics to write monthly reports.Business developer: every week, you call cultural organizations encouraging them to work with us. You travel around the country to visit cultural organizations;Manager: we will teach you how to be an entrepreneur by sending invoices, publishing vacancies, and eventually managing a team.INTK is one of the leading marketing agencies in the cultural sector. We are ambitious and looking forward to expanding with new ideas and markets. Within a couple of years, your position can grow into more responsibility and completely new tasks.YOU AREInterested in digital marketing and internet technology;You speak natively one of the following languages: Dutch, German, French, Slovenian, Spanish, Catalan, Italian, Finnish, Danish, Swedish, Polish, Portuguese, or Czech.What We OfferFull-time position;Gain experience with digital marketing in the cultural sector;Work with a young international team;Offices at the center of Utrecht;Five weeks holidays (25 days);Salary between € 2,200 and € 2,800 gross per month, based on knowledge and work experience.Perks And Benefits💻 MacBook and 4K External Screen🚂 Free train tickets for commuting or visiting clients✈️ Free airplane tickets for business development abroad☎️ Telephone/internet costs covered to up to 20euros/month🍌 Free healthy snacks🍹 Free drinks on Fridays👵 Flexible pension plan🎓 Learning budget🎭 Free subscription plan for cultural activitiesAre you interested? Apply herehttps://www.intk.com/en/vacancies/job-positions/digital-marketeerThe RoleAt INTK, you will be slowly responsible for all parts of the business. It includes:Digital marketeer: you will start by doing Google Ads campaigns. At a later stage, you might grow into doing Display and Facebook campaigns or any other marketing tasks that the cultural organization requests;Account manager: you are the contact person of at least 20 cultural organizations. You use Google Analytics to write monthly reports.Business developer: every week, you call cultural organizations encouraging them to work with us. You travel around the country to visit cultural organizations;Manager: we will teach you how to be an entrepreneur by sending invoices, publishing vacancies, and eventually managing a team.Ideal ProfileInterested in digital marketing and internet technology;You speak natively one of the following languages: Dutch, German, French, Slovenian, Spanish, Catalan, Italian, Finnish, Danish, Swedish, Polish, Portuguese, or Czech in order to be able to effectively liaise with stakeholders in the region.You have at least 1 year experience ideally in Digital Marketing within IT industry.Experience within would be a strong advantage.You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical dataYou are a strong networker & relationship builderYou are a self-starter and demonstrate a high level of resilienceWhat's on Offer?Strong opportunities to progress your careerAttractive Salary & BenefitsOpportunity to make a positive impact Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Microsoft’s Cloud business is experiencing explosive growth, and the Capacity, Supply Chain & Provisioning (CSCP) organization is responsible for enabling the infrastructure underlying this growth. Our mission is to deliver the world’s computer with an industry-leading supply chain. CSCP is responsible for strategic sourcing, customer demand forecasting, capacity planning and management, supply chain planning and execution, capacity provisioning, and decommissioning and dispositioning of datacenter assets worldwide.Within Azure Hardware Systems & Infrastructure, the Spares and Warranty team is responsible for ensuring that the right spare parts, are in the right place, at the right time in support of delivering global capacity requirements.We are looking for a Senior Program Manager able to develop and execute strategies to deliver Regional Service part Depots and related logistics capabilities (regional warehousing & distribution) at cloud scale in a dynamic, fast paced environment. This position is vital for enabling and empowering process & system change as part of the journey to world-class. The ideal candidate will have proven Supplier Relationship Management experience, previous spares/warranty warehouse management roles, and a passion for continuous improvement.ResponsibilitiesLocated onsite (Venlo) with outsourced provider to manage day to day business performanceServe as a functional expert in logistics, transportation and warehouse managementEnable reverse logistics processesProgram management, analyticsDrive vendor compliance with Microsoft Security standardsIdentifies process improvement opportunities and analyzes them for efficiency (waste, complexity, cost), effectiveness (achieves desired outcome), and qualityResponsible for managing continuous improvements and process initiativesCollaborate with cross functional teamsQualificationsRequired:Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain, industrial engineering OR extensive experience in warehouse and/or supply chain OR experience in Spares Parts and Warranty Expertise on spares parts/warranty supply chain warehouse, logistics, inventory management or reverse logistics Experience in Program management and analyticsMicrosoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. We’re JTI, Japan Tobacco International and we believe in freedom. We think that the possibilities are limitless when you’re free to choose. In fact, we’ve spent the last 20 years innovating, creating new and better products for our consumers to choose from. It’s how we’ve grown to be present in 130 countries.But our business isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen for our business.That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It is why 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI. And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, nine years running.So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.Learn more jti.comJOB TITLE JUNIOR BRAND MANAGER (m/f/d)LOCATION AMSTELVEEN, NETHERLANDSAre you ready to join one of the most challenging FMCG sectors within an international company that offers a lot of opportunities for growth and development?Are you passionate about Brand Management and Strategic Insights?Then we have the perfect role for you. For our Marketing team, we are looking for an ambitious full-time Junior Brand Manager in Amstelveen.About The RoleAs Junior Brand Manager you will be a part of the Marketing Agile Pool providing support to both Brand Management and Strategic Insights and managing multiple projects at the same time. In this role, you will also manage external parties, like creative agencies, on a day-to-day basis. The Junior Brand Manager will work in the Marketing team and report to the Marketing Director.Responsibilities Provides support to Brand Management by taking responsibility for the development and execution of brand activation towards internal, consumer and trade. Ensures compliance with brand platforms and guidelines and assists in the translation of brand strategies into actionable brand programs Develops permanent and temporary branded POS materials within budget and ensures timely delivery Assists the Strategic Insights team in collecting and distributing management information as well as setting up and managing market research projectsWHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR? HBO/University Degree (preferably in Marketing/Commerce) No previous working experience required or 1-2 years of experience as Junior Brand Manager in an FMCG company. Internship and/or traineeship in FMCG company in marketing, as well as knowledge/interest in market research, would be an advantage Fluent English and Dutch, both written and verbal. Computer skills Microsoft OfficeYou will be successful in this role, if you are Team player Proactive Cooperative FlexibleWHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? At JTI we believe in the importance of a good work-life balance while we offer lots of opportunities for development and career progression – across functions and internationally. Maybe that’s one of the reasons why our employees stay on average an impressive nine years with us and we have been certified as a Top Employer for over thirteen years now. Want to know more about how our employees rate us? Please visit https //www.glassdoor.nl/japantobaccointernationalNext to a rewarding compensation package, we offer a range of other perks and benefits The opportunity to work 50% of your time outside of the office and 10 days abroad per year Working from home equipment (e.g., chair, screen, mouse, and keypad) 25 vacation days + 9 so-called ADV days on a full-time base 13th-month salary Contribution-free pension Bonus scheme (7.5 %) Great development and training opportunities based on your ambitions and capabilities Different engagement activities such as dinners, drinks, social gatherings, parties, etc. Car allowance Working from home allowance Business laptop and iPhone Unique Family leave policy (at least 20 weeks of fully paid parental leave regardless of gender, sexual orientation, or the way of becoming parents)Sounds interesting? We’d love to hear from you! To make it easier for you to apply, there is no need to upload a cover letter. Only your CV is enough because we would like to get to know you in person.What Are The Next Steps – Recruitment ProcessWe will review all applications and make sure that every candidate receives a reply within 2 weeks after the application deadline. If we find your profile matches what we are looking for, one of our Talent Advisors (Angelika Majewska) from Warsaw will contact you as a first step.About JtiJTI – Japan Tobacco International – is a leading international tobacco company with headquarters in Geneva. As part of the JT-Group, JTI sells its brands in more than 120 countries with around 44,000 employees in over 70 countries worldwide.JTI is committed to building a more sustainable future. If we are to achieve our targets, sustainability must be part of the mindset of all our employees and be part of our day-to-day decisions.Find out more at www.jti.comDIVERSITY & INCLUSIONJTI is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. We celebrate the differences that make us unique and strongly believe in a world where you have the freedom to express yourself. Where you can be proud and confident no matter who you are. A world in which we are all equal!That’s why all applicants will receive fair consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, maternity, or pregnancy. Want to know more about Diversity and Inclusion at JTI? Please visit https //www.jti.com/about-us/our-business/freedom-be-yourselfIs this not your next career step, but do you know someone who is a perfect fit? Please let us know!JTI considers it important that this job vacancy is shared as much as possible. JTI therefore invites everyone to share this vacancy with people who might be interested and/or suitable for it. If this results in JTI hiring a suitable candidate, you can, under certain conditions, receive a referral bonus of 500 Euros, to be paid out in the form of vouchers. Want to know more about this bonus? Please contact Roy Blookvort (roy.blookvort@jti.com) and ask for the conditions. This policy does not apply to recruitment agencies or recruitment consultants. COMMERCIAL BUSINESS CONTROLLEREindhoven, The Netherlands Our client is a global leader in the packaging industry, operating in more than 10 countries around the world. Based on innovation and sustainability, it’s an expanding company with over 2,000 FTE´s world-wide.They are currently looking for a solid Business Controller to join the Finance Team in the Netherlands. The Business Controller will be responsible for analyzing financial and business information, solicited and unsolicited advice to management and develop, implement, and maintain business reporting and control systems, in and outside the domain and in line with internal and external regulations and industry standards and best practices. Key tasks and responsibilities:Business controlDevelop and maintain the business- and internal controls in the business, develop business cases and setup, implement, and maintain business case models and perform ROI calculations. Proactively monitor, analyze, and challenge budgets and performance of the assigned domain on a periodical (monthly) basis, to assure timely anticipation on in- and external developments.Expert Advice Advise management on forecasting, budgeting, and strategy execution, to facilitate effective financial decision-making.Performing risk analysis together with the Business Process Owners of the relevant departments. Based on the risk analysis,design, implement, and maintain a governance structure for the relevant departments in accordance with the overall governance structure and monitor compliance.Financial ControlPlan, organize, coordinate, and execute the financial planning and control cycle, within the assigned domain, to assure optimal control of all financial and business parameters. Develop business procedures to optimize the planning and control cycle.Develop, implement, monitor, and optimize financial control policies, in line with internal and external regulations and industry standards and best practices, to assure compliance with financial procedures and legislation.ComplianceEnsure the development, preparation, and proper execution of (consolidated) periodical and ad hoc reports for stakeholders.Provide a translation of the performance of the department in a report for business management/ functional management, to ensure that relevant stakeholders are provided with relevant, accurate and up-to-date financial reporting for effective and efficient decision-making.Continuous improvementContributes to improve internal procedures and processes; assists in solving daily problems, suggest improvements to optimize process, handling, and result.Expertise ManagementBuild, maintain and share knowledge and content to increase understanding and sustain the department’s expertise. Identify, apply, and share best practices.Requirements:Bachelor and/or master’s in economics, accounting or Business Economics; Proven controller experience focusing on sales and reporting activity; Ability to be adaptable and flexible and operate effectively in a relatively fast-paced and growing environment. Strong communication skills, persuasive and able to work with a variety of stakeholders; Experience with business intelligence tools, data-mining techniques, and MS-Office Suite products; Experience with SAP and Microsoft Office applications; This is really a great opportunity for a driven Business Controller that wants to be part of an ambitious organization and highly motivated team, with lots of opportunities for personal and professional growth. It’s an informal organization, where they challenge you and want you to challenge them. Your contribution will make a direct impact on our day-to-day operations. Location: Eindhoven, The Netherlands (hybrid role with expectations of 3 days at the office) – with occasional business trips to other countries. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

In this role, you will also manage external parties, like creative agencies, on a day-to-day basis. The Junior Brand Manager will work in the Marketing team and report to the Marketing Director.Responsibilities Provides support to Brand Management by taking responsibility for the development and execution of brand activation towards internal, consumer and trade. Ensures compliance with brand platforms and guidelines and assists in the translation of brand strategies into actionable brand programs Develops permanent and temporary branded POS materials within budget and ensures timely delivery Assists the Strategic Insights team in collecting and distributing management information as well as setting up and managing market research projectsWHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR? HBO/University Degree (preferably in Marketing/Commerce) No previous working experience required or 1-2 years of experience as Junior Brand Manager in an FMCG company. Internship and/or traineeship in FMCG company in marketing, as well as knowledge/interest in market research, would be an advantage Fluent English and Dutch, both written and verbal. Computer skills Microsoft OfficeYou will be successful in this role, if you are Team player Proactive Cooperative FlexibleWHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? At JTI we believe in the importance of a good work-life balance while we offer lots of opportunities for development and career progression – across functions and internationally. Maybe that’s one of the reasons why our employees stay on average an impressive nine years with us and we have been certified as a Top Employer for over thirteen years now. Want to know more about how our employees rate us? Please visit https //www.glassdoor.nl/japantobaccointernationalNext to a rewarding compensation package, we offer a range of other perks and benefits The opportunity to work 50% of your time outside of the office and 10 days abroad per year Working from home equipment (e.g., chair, screen, mouse, and keypad) 25 vacation days + 9 so-called ADV days on a full-time base 13th-month salary Contribution-free pension Bonus scheme (7.5 %) Great development and training opportunities based on your ambitions and capabilities Different engagement activities such as dinners, drinks, social gatherings, parties, etc. Car allowance Working from home allowance Business laptop and iPhone Unique Family leave policy (at least 20 weeks of fully paid parental leave regardless of gender, sexual orientation, or the way of becoming parents)Sounds interesting? We’d love to hear from you! To make it easier for you to apply, there is no need to upload a cover letter. Only your CV is enough because we would like to get to know you in person.What Are The Next Steps – Recruitment ProcessWe will review all applications and make sure that every candidate receives a reply within 2 weeks after the application deadline. If we find your profile matches what we are looking for, one of our Talent Advisors (Angelika Majewska) from Warsaw will contact you as a first step.About JtiJTI – Japan Tobacco International – is a leading international tobacco company with headquarters in Geneva. As part of the JT-Group, JTI sells its brands in more than 120 countries with around 44,000 employees in over 70 countries worldwide.JTI is committed to building a more sustainable future. If we are to achieve our targets, sustainability must be part of the mindset of all our employees and be part of our day-to-day decisions.Find out more at www.jti.comDIVERSITY & INCLUSIONJTI is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. We celebrate the differences that make us unique and strongly believe in a world where you have the freedom to express yourself. Where you can be proud and confident no matter who you are. A world in which we are all equal!That’s why all applicants will receive fair consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, maternity, or pregnancy. Want to know more about Diversity and Inclusion at JTI? Please visit https //www.jti.com/about-us/our-business/freedom-be-yourselfIs this not your next career step, but do you know someone who is a perfect fit? Please let us know!JTI considers it important that this job vacancy is shared as much as possible. JTI therefore invites everyone to share this vacancy with people who might be interested and/or suitable for it. If this results in JTI hiring a suitable candidate, you can, under certain conditions, receive a referral bonus of 500 Euros, to be paid out in the form of vouchers. Want to know more about this bonus? Please contact Roy Blookvort (roy.blookvort@jti.com) and ask for the conditions. This policy does not apply to recruitment agencies or recruitment consultants. Benieuwd naar nieuwe ontwikkelingen? Houden innovaties jou bezig? Altijd al willen weten welke technieken er achter de apps, websites en software zit die je dagelijks gebruikt?Ontdek de wereld van Software Engineering bij Educom in Arnhem en leer in 12 maanden een specialistisch vak door op een hoog en professioneel (abstractie)niveau concepten te begrijpen en toe te passen in innovatieve mobiele, webbased en desktop (applicatie) oplossingen.FunctieomschrijvingOp zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging, momenteel geen job, net afgestudeerd of oriënterend op de arbeidsmarkt? Maak kennis met ons en kom erachter hoe Educom haar traineeship samen met jou op maat vormgeeft. Combineer ons specialisme met jouw enthousiasme! Zet een e- voor jouw carrière en beleef software. e-ducom maakt het mogelijk!FunctieprofielIn 40 jaar heeft Educom een Proof of Concept (POC) ontwikkeld. Met jarenlange vakkennis vanuit inhoud, door 2.000 ervaringen met zowel kandidaten als opdrachtgevers en met het opbouwen van een groot netwerk, is ons concept geëvolueerd en heeft zich ontplooid tot een modulair traineeship.Onze aanpak is uniek, doordat het volledig afhankelijk is van jouw (inhoudelijke en persoonlijke) ontwikkeling. Het (gezamenlijke) doel is om het maximale uit je kwaliteiten te halen. Het is onmogelijk om vooraf te weten wie je bent, hoever de mogelijkheden van jouw kwaliteiten reiken, welke opdrachtgever goed bij je past en of je kunt voldoen aan de verwachtingen.Op eigen rekening en risico investeren wij in de vakopleiding van programmeren. De essentie is om het vak te begrijpen. Afhankelijk van je ontwikkeling (leercurve), bereiken we een diepgang die we matchen met onze opdrachtgevers. Hiermee managen we de verwachtingen, voor alle partijen. Op persoonlijk vlak maken alle partijen gezamenlijk een duurzame keuze. Zo kun je jaren werkervaring opdoen en je verder ontwikkelen in de praktijk.De eerste fase van ons traineeship bestaat uit Essentials® waarbij je fundamentele concepten, vak-interpretatie, structuren, verbanden, gelaagdheid en patronen leert begrijpen op een hoog conceptueel en abstractieniveau. Hierbij gaat het om (diepgaande) taal- en platformonafhankelijke kennis van programmeren als vak. We leren je hoe je met de tools uit software stacks omgaat. Dit is geen trucje, maar begrip. “Use the tool, don’t be a tool.”De tweede fase bestaat uit Elaborations® waarbij differentiatie plaatsvindt in toepassingsgebieden van de geleerde concepten, zoals closed-source (proprietary software) omgevingen (Microsoft .NET), open-source omgevingen (Java), webomgevingen (PHP) of juist een specialisatie als front-end development (React, Angular, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3), mobile development (Xamarin, React Native) of UX/UI, IxD design. Verdieping op layer-niveau of juist full-stack.Programmeren is een vak dat door onze praktijkdocenten/-coaches in gestructureerde vorm aangeleerd wordt. Het vak leer je in het programmeerparadigma van Objectgeoriënteerd programmeren (OOP). Het paradigma is de mindset, de oplossing is leidend en de (programmeer-, script-) talen als PHP, Java, C#(.NET), JavaScript en Python zijn de uitvoering. In toepassingen leer je onder andere werken in opensource software-ontwikkelomgevingen en in geïntegreerde software-ontwikkelomgevingen (IDE’s) als (Microsoft) Visual Studio, NetBeans of Eclipse. Hierbij leer je werken met design patterns als MVC, MVVM, MVP en Observer pattern op (multi-, cross- of onafhankelijke) platformen/frameworks als .NET, ASP.NET, Symfony, Laravel, React, Spring, jQuery en Angular. Aan de hand van softwareontwikkelmethodes als Agile (Scrum) en Test Driven Development (TDD) leer je samenwerken en omgaan met versiebeheersystemen als Git en Subversion.Wij vragenWanneer jij;beschikt over een HBO- of Academische opleiding of aantoonbaar niveau; je wordt getoetst en geanalyseerd op aanleg, dus een (gerichte) vooropleiding is niet vereist;intrinsiek gemotiveerd en geïnteresseerd bent om het vak programmeren te leren en/of in de eindeloze mogelijkheden van het multidisciplinaire vakgebied van Software Engineering;de diverse fasen van een software(ontwikkel)proces wilt ontdekken vanuit diverse rollen als developer, analist, architect, designer, tester en consultant;gefascineerd raakt door de oneindige mogelijkheden van de techniek;graag meegaat met technologische trends en bereid bent continu te investeren in kennis;bereid bent te investeren in jezelf en jouw carrière;fulltime inzetbaar bent en mobiliteitsbereid (maximaal één uur enkele reisafstand); we werken local-for-local en naar verwachting wordt er steeds meer thuisgewerkt;beschikt over goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden;bereid bent onvoorwaardelijk onze waarden en normen te representeren;(exclusief) geselecteerd wordt als 1 van de 25 kandidaten die we per jaar per vestiging opleiden.Wij biedenBieden wij;een kwalitatieve, zware vakopleiding door praktijkgerichte vakdocenten (liefkozend vakidioten genoemd) en hiermee de mogelijkheid om een vak (ambacht) aan te leren;gegarandeerd een baan en werkervaring als junior Software Engineer;persoonlijke én inhoudelijke matching;professionele en persoonlijke begeleiding, waarbij we de verwachtingen managen en afstemmen met jouw leercurve, om succesvol je eerste stappen op de arbeidsmarkt te zetten als junior Software Engineer;de ideale arbeidsomstandigheden (omgeving/klimaat) en voorwaarden (salariëring) om jouw carrière zowel professioneel als persoonlijk maximaal te ontplooien;persoonlijke coaching door een specialist vanaf het eerste contactmoment, indien van toepassing of wenselijk; onder meer geleiding vanuit een werkende situatie, gesprekken over financiële en/of sociale stabiliteit, vrijstelling van sollicitatieplicht (als een uitkeringssituatie (WW of WWB) van toepassing is);toegang tot onze vakkennis (inhoud, netwerk en ervaring) en kennisdatabank;faciliterende zaken (onder andere werkplek, studiemateriaal en certificeringen);tot slot, onze bedrijfscultuur; maak kennis met ons warme karakter met zuidelijke invloeden en kom de échte Limburgse vlaai proeven.Hoe nu verder?Ben jij geinteresseerd in bovenstaand profiel voor Software Development Traineeship? Educom ziet graag jouw sollicitatie tegemoet! Door middel van het klikken op de solliciteerbutton kom je in een overzichtelijk sollicitatiescherm waar je met jouw CV kan reageren op de vacature van Software Development Traineeship. Intelligence toolsWorking experience with Microsoft Dynamics or similarIndustry experience in the Trading or Financial sectorWorking experience integrations across multiple systemsWorking experience working with 3rd party providers and vendorsWorking experience with user-facing custom software solutions and streamlining user experienceWhat We OfferCompetitive remuneration and bonus Microsoft’s Cloud business is experiencing explosive growth, and the Capacity, Supply Chain & Provisioning (CSCP) organization is responsible for enabling the infrastructure underlying this growth. Our mission is to deliver the world’s computer with an industry-leading supply chain. CSCP is responsible for strategic sourcing, customer demand forecasting, capacity planning and management, supply chain planning and execution, capacity provisioning, and decommissioning and dispositioning of datacenter assets worldwide.Within Azure Hardware Systems & Infrastructure, the Spares and Warranty team is responsible for ensuring that the right spare parts, are in the right place, at the right time in support of delivering global capacity requirements.We are looking for a Senior Program Manager able to develop and execute strategies to deliver Regional Service part Depots and related logistics capabilities (regional warehousing & distribution) at cloud scale in a dynamic, fast paced environment. This position is vital for enabling and empowering process & system change as part of the journey to world-class. The ideal candidate will have proven Supplier Relationship Management experience, previous spares/warranty warehouse management roles, and a passion for continuous improvement.ResponsibilitiesLocated onsite (Venlo) with outsourced provider to manage day to day business performanceServe as a functional expert in logistics, transportation and warehouse managementEnable reverse logistics processesProgram management, analyticsDrive vendor compliance with Microsoft Security standardsIdentifies process improvement opportunities and analyzes them for efficiency (waste, complexity, cost), effectiveness (achieves desired outcome), and qualityResponsible for managing continuous improvements and process initiativesCollaborate with cross functional teamsQualificationsRequired:Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain, industrial engineering OR extensive experience in warehouse and/or supply chain OR experience in Spares Parts and Warranty Expertise on spares parts/warranty supply chain warehouse, logistics, inventory management or reverse logistics Experience in Program management and analyticsMicrosoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. CSCP is responsible for strategic sourcing, customer demand forecasting, capacity planning and management, supply chain planning and execution, capacity provisioning, and decommissioning and dispositioning of datacenter assets worldwide.Within Azure Hardware Systems & Infrastructure, the Spares and Warranty team is responsible for ensuring that the right spare parts, are in the right place, at the right time in support of delivering global capacity requirements.We are looking for a Senior Program Manager able to develop and execute strategies to deliver Regional Service part Depots and related logistics capabilities (regional warehousing & distribution) at cloud scale in a dynamic, fast paced environment. This position is vital for enabling and empowering process & system change as part of the journey to world-class. The ideal candidate will have proven Supplier Relationship Management experience, previous spares/warranty warehouse management roles, and a passion for continuous improvement.ResponsibilitiesLocated onsite (Venlo) with outsourced provider to manage day to day business performanceServe as a functional expert in logistics, transportation and warehouse managementEnable reverse logistics processesProgram management, analyticsDrive vendor compliance with Microsoft Security standardsIdentifies process improvement opportunities and analyzes them for efficiency (waste, complexity, cost), effectiveness (achieves desired outcome), and qualityResponsible for managing continuous improvements and process initiativesCollaborate with cross functional teamsQualificationsRequired:Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain, industrial engineering OR extensive experience in warehouse and/or supply chain OR experience in Spares Parts and Warranty Expertise on spares parts/warranty supply chain warehouse, logistics, inventory management or reverse logistics Experience in Program management and analyticsMicrosoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world. Get to Know our Team: The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples: Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, Tripadvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests. Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders What you’ll Need to Succeed: Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study Experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently It’s Great if you Have: Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce Experience with A/B Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration.
