Jouw baan: Senior Java Software Engineer UtrechtWil jij graag deel uitmaken van één van de snelst groeiende Silicon Valley Tech SaaS-bedrijven van de wereld?Wil jij werken in een cultuur waarbij wat onmogelijk leek, toch mogelijk werd door samen met de slimste domeinspecialisten niet op te geven!? (if you can dream it, you can build it! 😊)Bouw jij graag aan een uniek en al bewezen SaaS-product dat het leven makkelijker maakt voor tientallen miljoenen mensen wereldwijd, wat snel groeit naar honderden miljoenen?!Wil jij werken met alleen de beste van de beste engineers die hebben gewerkt bij Facebook, Google of Amazon waardoor jij een enorme groeicurve kan maken?Wat te denken van een salarishuis die kan concurreren met de Amazons en FaceBooks van deze wereld + mogelijkheid op aandelen en een top notch ‘people-first’ Work Life Balance beleid (remote mogelijkheden, flexibele werktijden)?Bouw jij naast de meest sustainable Data, AI en high performant nieuwbouw oplossingen Core Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, Elasticsearch, AWS, ook graag mee aan een nieuwe DevHub hier in Nederland? Begint jouw software hart sneller te kloppen en je typevingers te jeuken? Reageer direct hieronder of lees verder!Jouw werkgever: Verduurzaamt een nieuw Wereldwijd domein voor honderden miljoenen mensen!Hoe maak je de toekomst van hoe mensen zich verplaatsen zo makkelijk en duurzaam mogelijk? Hoe breng je alle denkbare touchpoints van een nog ontgonnen wereldwijd domein samen? De oprichters van deze scale up zijn met hun revolutionair idee jarenlang uitgelachen door investeerders, nu is het tij gekeerd en bepalen zij de toekomst! Het succes van dit Saas product zit hem in het gebruiksgemak, de tastbare eenvoudigheid en slimme software die nog nooit eerder is vertoond. Met het vertrouwen van dezelfde groep vroege investeerders in tech bedrijven als LinkedIn, Amazon en Facebook zijn er voor deze scale up onbegrensde groeimogelijkheden. In een relatief korte tijd heeft men hier een kick-ass engineeringcultuur weten op te zetten. Je werkt hier niet alleen met de beste van de beste engineers, maar je krijgt ook de kans om de engineeringcultuur verder helpen op te zetten. Zelfsturende autonome teams, agile, delivery automation, test automation of clean coding, dit hoef je hier niemand uit te leggen! Deze tech organisatie heeft bewezen dat een Digital First wereld dichterbij is dan ooit! Binnen deze scale up krijg je de autonomie voor het opzetten van de backend Infrastructuur, het Designen en bouwen van verschillende greenfield backend oplossingen rondom schaal, AI/ML en greenfield feature development. Ownership en autonomie is hier niet een pre maar DE standaard!Jouw Rol: Senior Java Software Engineer UtrechtIn jouw rol als Senior Java Software Engineer Utrecht werk je aan een specifiek die continue het platform verrijken, laten schalen of nog slimmere producten weten te creëren voor een wereldwijde klantgroep. Omdat de codebase maximaal 2 jaar oud is, ben jij hier voornamelijk bezig met greenfield vraagstukken. Vind jij werken aan performance vraagstukken leuk of juist een heel nieuw product bouwen of bijt jij liever je tanden vast in A.I/Ml puzzles? Hier kun jij jouw engineering hart echt laten kloppen op volle toeren! Jouw potentiële collega’s hebben al lovende feedback gekregen: “een zeer complex probleem opgelost op een revolutionaire, intuïtieve en zeer gebruiksvriendelijke manier”. De engineeringcultuur is open, de organisatiestructuur plat, met snelle beslissingscycli, zodat je snel vooruit kunt met je ideeën en je kunt focussen op het creëren van waarde voor de gebruikers, zonder enige bureaucratie of vervelende politiek. Bij alles wat je bouwt, heb je te maken met complexiteiten zoals schaalbaarheid, testen en performance. Je werkt nauw samen met Design, front-end en Product waardoor je altijd dicht bij het product zit en maximale impact ervaart voor de eindgebruikers! De techstack (hoewel jij helpt om dit verder te ontwikkelen): Core Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, Elasticsearch, AWS, Cloud Native, Microservices, klantgerichte benadering, TDD, voortdurend proberen de tech innovatiecurve voor te zijn!Wat wordt er gevraagd? 6+ jaar professionele ervaring in Java software developmentErvaring met Core Java en Spring BootErvaring met Kafka of CQS is een preErvaring met Cloud (native) op AWS of GCP is een preGreenfield productontwikkeling binnen start/scale up is een pre(Goede) kennis clean coding, testen en/of performance optimalisatieJe deelt graag kennis en investeert in jezelfKennis van Cloud en MicroservicesErvaring met het werken aan klantgerichte systemen van Enterprise-kwaliteit met veel gelijktijdige gebruikers is een voordeelEen afgeronde technische BSc of MSc is een préWat wordt er aangeboden?Salaris tot +- € 125.000-, op basis van kennis, ervaring en toegevoegde waardeHybride werken (remote First policy uit NL)Ruim pakket aandelenopties (maak het samen GROOT!)Goed pensioenFocus Fridays (geen bijeenkomsten voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling)Collectieve zorgverzekeringOnbeperkte carrièremogelijkhedenOplossingen bouwen die 3 jaar geleden onmogelijk lekenWil je als Senior Java Software Engineer greenfield-producten bouwen binnen een disruptieve groeimarkt en het leven van honderden miljoenen mensen makkelijker maken?Solliciteer dan nu via het onderstaande formulier of stuur je CV naar Serge Warbout via s.warbout@codeguild.nl Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Your role: Senior Java Software Engineer AmsterdamWould you like to work for a medium-sized product company that builds a global real-time data platform from scratch with unprecedented freedom in architecture, design, and stack choice?Would you like the software you build to be used by the world's largest companies and thus directly impact billions of consumers worldwide?Would you say yes to €20k to €30k in stock options, a year-end bonus, 26 vacation days, working from home 3 times a week, and just a kick-ass engineering culture? Then don't wait any longer, because this is the job for you!Your employer: Real-time platform delivers unparalleled insights for the largest companies in the world!This medium-sized international software company in Amsterdam has been very successful in recent years with their unique SaaS product. This allure software product is used by the most impactful companies in the world, with billions of consumers (yes, you read it right, billions!). This product helps them to gain real-time insight into how they can serve billions of consumers even more efficiently. What a satisfaction, knowing that your software has an impact on billions of consumers. Although they have several very successful Dev Hubs in the world, they are now fully focused on Amsterdam as the next chapter of their great growth strategy! This allows you to work with the very best engineers worldwide, allowing you to learn a lot and grow unprecedentedly. Joining here now means you get the unique opportunity to further shape the new Amsterdam Dev Hub, really form one of the pillars, and help shape their already great tech culture. Here, freedom, responsibility, knowledge sharing, personal development, and collaboration are the most important drivers. How cool is that?! Because they only want to accept the best of the best here, they understand that engineers like you perform best when given enough freedom, autonomy, and responsibility. But the work-life balance is especially important at all times. For example, you can work from home 3 days a week, you are entitled to between €20k & €30k stock options (not to mention how much this will be worth in 5 years 😉), you get a year-end bonus, is there a training budget, do you get 26 vacation days and you can even work remotely for one month a year.Your role: Senior Java Software Engineer AmsterdamAs a Senior Java Software Engineer Amsterdam you get the unique opportunity to build the already successful SaaS streaming product from scratch. Think of design, architecture, stack choice, delivery automation, scalability, performance, and code quality. You can all sink your teeth here! Amsterdam has therefore been specifically chosen as one of the international elite teams that can rebuild this Realtime Data-Streaming platform. Talk about impact! Of course, you'll be working with some of the brightest techies out there, who you can spar with and learn from, who know the key fundamentals of building quality scalable software that runs through tens of millions of events every day. Ownership and autonomy are not a pre here, but the standard! In addition, you will have the opportunity to work closely with a highly experienced and inspiring CTO and to provide your input on the strategic (technical) course of the company. You should consider what kind of a boost this can mean for your career.Career opportunitiesIt is considered extremely important that the engineers within this organization are sufficiently challenged. That's why concerns don't just look at technical, horizontal challenges here, but you can also grow here to either Handson Architect or even Team Lead. Both are possible! It just depends on which direction you want to go.What is being asked?At least 5 years of professional backend development experienceProfessional experience with Java8+ or any other JVM languageA completed BSc or MSc in Computer Science or similar is a plusExperience designing and building highly scalable, load-heavy backend servicesExperience with streaming technology such as Kafka or Flink is a big plusExperience with containers such as Docker and/or Kubernetes is a plusExperience with cloud such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plusYou have a high quality, product and TDD mindsetWhat is being offered?Salary between €80.000 and €100.000 based on knowledge and added value+ approx. 1 month end-of-year bonusStocks between €20k & €30k1 month per year fully remote working in the country of your choice26 vacation days3 working days from home a weekSolid pensionTravel allowanceMacbook or LaptopPossibility for trainings/courses to followRelocation package of €3.500Are you a strong Senior Java Software Engineer who would like to build a Realtime Streaming-Data platform from scratch so that you can make a big impact on billions of consumers?Register now using the form below, or send your resume to Roy Schaper at r.schaper@codeguild.nlPs. Should this vacancy not match your interests and are you looking for other impactful Java or Kotlin Backend positions? Feel free to contact me without obligation! Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

We're Creative Fabrica, a fast scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.Our missionEnable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating and sharing. The 'Creative Inspiration Flywheel'This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.About The PlatformWe launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 6 years we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, viewing over 10 million+ listed products from 14000+ active designers.Our focus is to create a platform for designers that enables them to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.Job DescriptionWe are growing. Fast. You will help us grow even faster.In Product, we are responsible for Creative Fabrica's core platform. We find out what our customers', designers' and internal users' current challenges are, and discover new opportunities! We come up with effective solutions that are valuable (that our customers choose to buy or use), viable (that work within the constraints of the business), usable (that the user can easily navigate) and feasible (that our engineers have the skills, time and technology to implement).ResponsibilitiesAnalyzing the platform's goals, user needs, and overall experience to identify opportunities for gamification. Designing and implementing engaging game elements, such as rewards, challenges, and progression systems, to enhance user engagement and retention. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and UX/UI designers, to ensure seamless integration of gamification features into the platform. Conducting user research and testing to gather feedback and refine the gamification strategy. Monitoring and analyzing user behavior and engagement metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of gamification features and make data-driven improvements. Staying up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in gamification, as well as relevant industry advancements and emerging technologies. Creating and maintaining documentation on gamification design, strategy, and implementation for internal reference and communication with stakeholders. Educating and training team members on the principles of gamification and its benefits to the platform and user experience. To excel in this role, you have a proven track record of designing and executing gamification strategies. You either worked as a game designer, a gamification expert or launched your own mobile app or website/app that relied heavily on gamification. You have experience scaling to 1 million+ users.Your ProfileEssential:UX/UI design: Proficiency in designing user interfaces and experiences that are both visually appealing and user-friendly. Game design principles: A deep understanding of game mechanics, dynamics, and aesthetics, as well as experience in creating engaging game experiences. Technical skills: you are able to assess what is feasible within the limitations of the platform and available development resources. Data analysis: Ability to analyze user behavior and engagement metrics to make data-driven decisions and optimize gamification features. Required soft skills: Creativity: The ability to think outside the box and come up with innovative gamification ideas that resonate with users and drive engagement. Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to clearly convey ideas, concepts, and design decisions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Problem-solving: The ability to analyze complex problems and develop effective solutions, balancing the needs of users, business goals, and technical constraints. Nice to have: Experience in game developmentFounded and scaled your own business through gamificationHave an ImpactAt Creative Fabrica we look for and work with individuals who are passionate about what they do, not just as a job, but as a craft. We believe our technology will make or break the company, and this is why we are hiring only exceptional talent. In return, we give you trust. This means that you will work on code that hits millions of eyeballs each month. We move fast, and we trust you and your skills.Let us take care of you.Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills and ambition should be fairly compensated. Flexibility: 30 remote days per year. Need a change of scene? Take your laptop, pack a bag and work from the woods, your parents' place or the beach. The best tools and stylish kit: Laptop. Check. Collaboration tools. Check. Killer accessories. Check. Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the centre, working here means delicious lunches in the garden, Friday beers at our local bar, and access to our own CF library. TGIF: Work Life balance is important - we work hard together, and we have fun together. On Fridays we turn on the speakers, and start celebrating the weekend. Is this you?Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.You can apply by clicking the "Apply now" button.Creative Fabrica is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Interested in roles similar to this? Subscribe to our newsletter and get notified about new relevant openings! Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

At Picnic, we’re revolutionizing the way people buy groceries with our innovative and sustainable app-only service. We do almost everything in-house, developing cutting-edge technologies and processes to ensure we continue to grow rapidly without missing a beat. If you’re passionate about a career in data analytics and consulting and are driven to succeed, we’re offering you the opportunity to join the diverse team at our Amsterdam office and make a real difference in our scaleup environment.🥜 In a nutshellFirst things first: The role of an intern at Picnic is a versatile one. From day one, you’ll coordinate a personal project in a holistic and sustainable way and play a crucial role in Picnic’s business model. It’s important to us that you run the whole project from initiation to implementation.You’ll get to be part of one of our five analyst teams (Fulfillment, Distribution, Commercial, Growth, and Expansion) and will work closely with colleagues from the Netherlands, Germany, and France. You’ll have a mentor who will be supporting you during your whole Picnic journey, standing ready for any personal or professional challenges coming your way!Some projects examples that you could be working on during your internship:Project 1: Deep-dive into (regional) customer demand related topicsProject 2: Determine the distribution of article demand We also are currently looking for one working-student in the Customer success team. Knowledge in Excel, Google Sheets, Python/ JavaScript / Matlab are required.🎯 What you’ll doEnable operational excellence by approaching challenges with a data-driven and analytical mindsetBuild and optimize models for process improvementsCommunicate effectively with different teams to deliver impactful and sustainable solutions⭐ About youYou are currently enrolled in a Bachelor or Master’s program in a quantitative field of study, such as in Mathematics, Econometrics, Engineering, AI, or equivalentYour communication skills allow you to convert abstract plans into digestible information for your teamYou are fluent in both verbal and written EnglishAvailability: at least 4-6 months for a regular internshipYou're still wondering if it's the right role for you, and you'd like to hear more about the role? Email our recruiter Laure (laure.calimez@teampicnic.com) and ask for a short call together in order to get more insights before you actually apply. (Please make sure that you fit the requirements in the "About you" section.)📖 Picnic PerksEvery expert was once a beginner! You’ll get plenty of opportunities to challenge yourself and grow, including the Picnic Tech Academy, Lunch & Learn sessions, and tailored soft skills training. We also offer free professional weekly language courses.Make a differenceYou’ll work in an awesome startup environment with the freedom to drive your own projects and create a visible impact.Our fully electric vehicles and sustainable business model mean you’ll also be contributing to making the world a better place!Teamwork makes the dream workWith more than 80 nationalities across 3 countries, you’ll be part of a diverse company with plenty of cool stuff to get involved with, from board game evenings to after-work drinks to our company ski trip and more!You Are What You EatYou’ll get freshly prepared, healthy lunches and snacks (with plenty of vegetarian, vegan, and halal options). Coffee snob? Don’t worry, our amazing Picnic barista has you covered.Stay healthy Mental health is important. As well as having the option to speak with Picnic colleagues who act as confidential advisors, our collaboration with OpenUp gives you easy access to professional psychologists, along with workshops and materials.There are plenty of sports communities and events to get involved with, from tennis to yoga to climbing!Attractive packageWe offer €800 per month gross salary for a full-time internship as well as 12.5 vacation days per six months, so you can recharge your batteriesWork-life balanceWhere possible, we like to enable people to work in ways that suit their working styles, which is why we have a hybrid-working model. Our teams generally like to have at least one team day per week at the office (the tasty lunch and Barista-made coffee may be a factor), but besides that, it’s up to you and your team.Commitment to equal opportunities Picnic is an equal opportunity employer—this means that all decisions regarding applications will be based on qualifications and merit. Do you want to be part of the grocery revolution? At Picnic you get the chance to join a young and forward-thinking startup culture, where everything you do matters. We have recently founded a new team that is working on defining a next generation simulation system from scratch. The team is working on detailed simulations of some of the largest automated fulfillment centers in Europe, and builds models of new warehousing and automation concepts that will enable us to expand as never before. The simulations serve as virtual sites that provide a risk-free environment to analyze and test our automated warehouses. They support our software development, commissioning, and enable our analysts to validate new warehousing concepts and improve existing ones. Your primary responsibility will be to develop the tool to simulate new and improved automated warehouses, capturing the complex dynamics between hardware, software, and humans. You will strive to find innovative ways to replicate real-world conditions of warehouse components within these models and drive implementation in the team. Additionally, you will conduct research on simulation and digital twin technologies and drive innovation of the system, to ensure that our system is future-proof. You will also provide support to developers and analysts to effectively utilize our simulation system, playing a critical role in optimizing warehouse operations and improving efficiency.🔥 What Challenges Await YouDesign, develop, and test software for our warehouse simulation system that allows simulating warehouse operations for testing software, analyze new automation strategies, and validate to be build warehouse layoutsCreate high-quality code that is scalable, reliable and reusable to build an everlasting tool👉🏼 Who You AreYou have a curious mindset and enjoy exploring the intricacies of systems and processes. We meet at the intersection of groceries and tech - leveraging software and data to offer a new solution to an old problem. Our warehouses are including more and more data and automation - and through our Simulation Systems, we have it all under control. 🍩 Picnic perksLocated in Amsterdam, our fun-filled office is the best place for you to focus on your Picnic projects. Eye has a mission: to digitally secure SMEs in Europe. This initiative comes from the dream of former intelligence and security service employees in the Netherlands to also protect smaller companies from the increasing threat of cybercrime. We've been doing this since 2020 and are now a team of almost 80 passionate and talented professionals who all have something in common: a strong aversion to (digital) injustice. description: Het is als bedrijf tegenwoordig van groot belang bij te blijven als het gaat om ontwikkeling op IT gebied. Digitalisering is niet meer een keuze maar een noodzaak geworden om relevant te blijven. Bij dit IT consultancybedrijf weten ze dat je altijd een stap voor moet blijven op je concurrent. Hier staat internet security hoog in het vaandel en werken ze snel doch secuur. Help jij mee aan deze successen te werken?Klinkt leuk, maar waar heb je het over?Er zijn een hoop consultancy bureaus in Nederland, maar er zijn er maar weinig die zelfs in deze rare tijden nog weten te groeien. Dit is er één van. En niet zonder reden. Ze werken namelijk alleen met de beste mensen aan de gaafste projecten.Nu zal je denken, dat heb ik eerder gehoord. Alleen is het dit keer ook echt waar. Het begint bij de eisen die ze stellen aan hun consultants. Iedereen heeft namelijk een Masterdiploma. En het gaat niet alleen om kennis, maar ook om de soft skills die nodig zijn om die kennis toe te passen. Het bedrijfskundige inzicht, de communicatieve vaardigheden en de politieke sensitiviteit die je nodig hebt om anderen te informeren, overtuigen en enthousiasmeren. Hun consultants zijn dan ook echte talenten en stuk-voor-stuk, indrukwekkende professionals.Daarnaast zijn ze niet alleen veeleisend richting hun eigen medewerkers, maar ook richting hun klanten. Van de grootste banken en verzekeraars, tot bouwbedrijven en energiemaatschappijen. Grote bedrijven met nog grotere uitdagingen. Als het niet onwijs complex en haast onmogelijk is, dan doen ze het niet.Interessant, maar wat heb je van mij nodig dan?Binnen de projecten die dit bedrijf voor haar klanten uitvoert is er altijd een uitdaging voor een software engineer zoals jij. Een jonge talentvolle Front-end Developer die alle ins en out betreft Front-end development wil leren. Met de kennis die jij al meebrengt en jouw leergierigheid, ben jij misschien wel de perfecte kandidaat voor deze baan.Dat ben ik inderdaad, maar ik werk niet gratisGelukkig wordt je niet alleen iedere dag uitgedaagd bij dit bedrijf, je wordt ook nog eens goed beloond. Naast een jaarsalaris tot €55.000 bruto ontvang je ook mooie secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een premievrij pensioen en een lease auto. Bovendien ben je er zeker van dat je alleen samenwerkt met de besten in hun vakgebied, van Data Scientists en Developers, tot UX Researchers. Klaar voor de volgende challenge? Klik op Apply, zodat het echte werk kan beginnen. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Type vacature: RegulierCity: AmstelveenHours per week: 40Education: HBO Bachelor; HBO Master; HBO Master/ WO-pre-master; WO MasterApply before: 28-05-2023 Introduction A leading edge stack, team members from all over the world, impact on a global scale : it’s the day-to-day life of our digital F ront -end E ngineers. We are dealing with the unique challenge to deliver a multi-branded web app of enterprise scale: our metrics (like amount of visitors and revenue) are expressed in multiple millions. And the good news is: we're looking for a few more talented engineers! As an engineer you will be welcomed in one of our Agile teams where you will join the adventure to reach increasing levels of high performance.We are looking for a developer who has specific interest in information analysis and would like to combine this with engineering. The information analysis consists of analyzing business questions (‘what is the real problem?’) and determining which solution scenarios are applicable. In determining these, the whole IT-landscape and existing designs, technical requirements and impact on business processes and innovation should be taken into account. Therefore good stakeholder management (e.g. business owners, product owners, users, architects, other teams) is key. What are you going to do? You will be working in a challenging Agile scrum environment: very dynamic, complex and diverse, where things can and will change on a day to day basis.You will: help managing day to day releases; improve customer experience, building high end customer features to improve customer satisfaction; work together to keep the standards high; work in close contact with Google Angular core team; be a front runner in Angular stack, always on the latest version; try out new technologies that add value to our product and customer experience. Where do you land? We look forward to welcoming you as a Front-end Engineer in a team of teams together building AFKL front-end with an Agile mindset! In the current circumstances we work from home or in a hybrid form. But when possible, we work lean and mean, with flex working spaces and a ping pong table. Your team consists of highly motivated professionals, from different countries and with different backgrounds, who are pushing the edge with the latest tools. We work together intensively and across boundaries, also together with Air France counter parts in Paris and Valbonne. Your profile You have a great sense of responsibility, you see the bigger picture and do not stop before the customer is 100% happy! You like to take initiative, experiment and use your creativity and analytical ability to come up with the best solutions. Your features are KLM’s digital face to the customer. The compliments are yours for improving proactively! We offer Ability to use the latest technologies with your creativity to set trends Work in one of world’s leading Front-end teams with people from all across the world A gross salary between € 3.306,23 and € 6.392,07 per month Plenty of room for personal development and wonderful career opportunities A good pension scheme, end of the year bonus and 8 percent holiday pay 25 days of paid holiday and 5 extra days off Great discounts on airline tickets (if you have been in service for at least 6 months) A travel expenses scheme and free use of the bus network around Schiphol A MacBook Pro Discount of your health insurance A personal budget for sustainable employability Ready for your next destination? D on’t wait any longer, send us your CV before the final boarding call! A motivation letter is no longer required; we will simply ask you a couple of questions during your online application. Within two weeks you will receive a message from us. Your application procedure consists of two interviews and a case . Questions? If you would like to know more about the position, please contact the hiring manager. Call or e-mail the recruiter for questions about the application process. In both cases, don't forget to mention the vacancy number: #8026. Voor de provincies Friesland, Groningen en Drenthe is Yelgo dé specialistische detacheerder voor digitale professionals. Heb jij al een aantal jaren werkervaring op het gebied van Front end Development? Wil jij graag aan de slag bij één van onze toffe opdrachtgevers? Dan maken we graag kennis met jou! Is er een match en ga jij als Yelgo Digital aan de slag, dan start je ook met ons Development Program. Samen met de opdrachtgever en coach bespreken we waar jij je in gaat ontwikkelen. Personal of hard skills? Samen zorgen we ervoor dat jij en onze opdrachtgever morgen weer een stapje verder zijn dan vandaag.Waar ga je aan de slag?Onze opdrachtgevers zitten in Noord-Nederland en variëren van organisaties in het MKB, overheden en corporates. Samen met jou bespreken we jouw skills en ervaring, waar jouw ambities liggen en wat voor soort organisatie het beste bij jou past. Vind je het tof om op projectbasis ingezet te worden? Dan gaan we daar voor. Ga jij liever voor een langere samenwerking met jouw opdrachtgever? Ook dat is prima!Wat ga je doen?Je gaat samen met je multidisciplinaire en zelfsturende team meebouwen aan de oplossingen op de uitdagingen van morgen. Ontwikkelen van betekenisvolle software voor onze maatschappijKom jij ook samen met ons werken aan de Suites voor het Sociaal Domein? Dit is één van de meest gebruikte softwareoplossingen door gemeenten. De Suites voor het Sociaal Domein helpen gemeenten bij het ondersteunen van hun burgers. Specifiek bij het vinden van werk, het verstrekken van uitkeringen en het verstrekken van zorg- of jeugdzorgvoorzieningen.We werken met negen Agile/Scrum teams aan dit prachtige product en zoeken nu voor verschillende teams uitbreiding. Er liggen namelijk grote vernieuwingsplannen klaar. De toekomstige software zal worden ontwikkeld vanuit een zelf ontwikkelde, model-driven architectuur én in .NET/C# ontwikkelde functionaliteit.Het belangrijkste is dat jij blij wordt van het ontwikkelen van software binnen Microsoft omgevingen. Wij zijn op zoek naar iemand die al de nodige ervaring heeft opgedaan met C#, .NET of soortgelijke programmeertalen en omgevingen. We verwachten dat je nieuwsgierig bent naar onze huidige programmatuur en dat je het een uitdaging vindt om die te vernieuwen naar C# en .NET. Uiteraard begeleiden wij jou daarin en nemen wij je mee in onze huidige software. Met deze vernieuwing willen we ook meteen de kwaliteit van onze software verhogen. Daarin mag jij ook meedenken en voorstellen doen. Graag zelfs! Ga met ons in gesprek en op basis van jouw kennis, ervaring en wensen kunnen wij gezamenlijk die werkplek vinden waar jij je het beste thuis zal voelen. Je komt te werken in een Agile/Scrum team samen met andere software developers, testers, een product owner en een scrum master. Centric biedt ruime mogelijkheden voor leren en zelfontwikkeling. Bijvoorbeeld in het opdoen van nieuwe kennis om door te ontwikkelen in je functie (via onze CentricAcademy). Maar ook naar ander werk en andere functies als jij daaraan toe bent.Wat jij meebrengtHbo of wo werk- en denkniveauJe hebt kennis van C#, .NET of soortgelijke programmeertalen en omgevingenJe wilt (net als wij) leren en groeien in je vakWerkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie als softwareontwikkelaar is een préWij werken in Agile teams; dit spreekt je aan en je wilt daar graag in meewerkenWaar jij op kunt rekenenGoede arbeidsvoorwaarden met daarbij een marktconform maandsalaris, reiskostenvergoeding (woon-/werkverkeer), thuiswerkvergoeding en voorzieningen zoals laptop en telefoonFlexibiliteit om je werk in te delenDoorgroeimogelijkheden in diverse richtingenKans je te specialiseren in diverse richtingenKans je te specialiseren door uitgebreide opleidingsmogelijkheden26 vakantiedagenGoede pensioenvoorzieningenKortingen op verzekeringen, reizen, pretparken, kleding, hotelovernachtingen, sportabonnementen, telefoonabonnementen en nog veel meer!De unit waar jij komt te werkenVan uitvoering jeugdwet tot uitkeringsaanvraag, bijna alles wat je als burger met de overheid regelt verloopt via de oplossingen van Centric. Centric is al jarenlang een stabiele partner voor de lokale overheid. Onze gekwalificeerde professionals, technologische oplossingen en ervaring met specifieke brancheprocessen, zorgen ervoor dat overheden zich op hun kerntaken kunnen richten. Samen met onze klanten creëren we duurzame oplossingen die bijdragen aan het behalen van hun doelstellingen. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Do you like to work on projects in high tech applications were you are challenged with your Javascript/Typescript skills in complex medical applications, in Machine controllers, in Front-end systems with AI? And do you believe that you are in the driver seat of your technical career? Then TMC is the right company for you!| Your challenges?As a Front End Developer you know, how to specify, design and implement complex application front-end software systems in a multi-disciplinary environment. The challenge is getting the system working with the right quality, clean code and functionality.| What do we expect from you?You have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in Computer Sciences, Informatics or similar education with at least 3 years of experience in front-end application software – or system development. During your study and through professional experience you have gained expertise in one or more of the following topics:You have proven experience with programming in Javascript and/or Typescript in application development environments;Preferably experience with React and Redux libraries;Preferably experience with Cloud based solution with Google Cloud, AWS and/or Azure;Preferably experience with Databases like SQL, noSQL, Postgress, MongoDB, etc;Preferably experience with Kubernetes;Preferably experience with Jest as a testing framework;Worked with the Atlassian stack (Bitbucket, JIRA, Confluence);Experience on Micro Frontends;Experience with Git, Sass and/or Docker;You have an outspoken drive for delivering quality of your software code;You have experience in working according to Agile/SCRUM, SaFe methodologies;You can build software throughout the development cycle, and have experience with OOAD, TDD and CI;Preferably you have (domain) knowledge of business areas like Healthcare, High-Tech Machinery or Consumer Products;Finally we expect you to have a result driven attitude and good communication skills;Knowledge of Dutch is a plus. | What can you expect from TMC?TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.| Why choose for Employeneurship?We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Uren: 36-40Werkplek: Utrecht / vanuit huis / bij de opdrachtgeverErvaring: juniorLow-code, Java, Microsoft .NET of integratie. Met deze job leer je alle ins en outs van een van die expertises kennen. De pluspunten van jouw baan als junior software-engineer bij Capgemini in Utrecht? Die zijn er genoeg. Reken zeker op een energieke community van honderden IT’ers met focus op gezelligheid en verbinding, opdrachten bij toonaangevende organisaties in Nederland én volop kansen om je te ontwikkelen tot lead, architect of specialist.Jouw job in één alineaNog niet besloten waar jouw IT-hart precies ligt? Dat komt goed uit. Bij Capgemini – een van de grootste ICT-consultancybedrijven ter wereld – kun je alle kanten op. Via coaching en begeleiding word je voorbereid op innovatieve, complexe softwareprojecten. Na die kickstart ga je met een team van Capgemini-collega’s bij de opdrachtgever aan de slag. In veel gevallen met state-of-the-art-technologie. Denk aan Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, Kafka, Mendix, OutSystems, MuleSoft, Azure, AWS en Google Cloud. Het interessante aan jouw baan: je realiseert oplossingen met impact en ziet vaak direct resultaat. Het kan zomaar zijn dat je werkt aan een identiteitsautorisatiesysteem van belangrijke overheidsinstanties dat iedereen in Nederland gebruikt. Dat je de digitale leeromgeving van een grote vliegtuigmaatschappij creëert. Of bij een bekend retailbedrijf bijdraagt aan de transformatie naar een microservicelandschap in de cloud.Je thuisbasis bij CapgeminiDie is misschien wel het bijzonderste aan jouw werk. Jij bent onderdeel van een hechte community van wereldwijd ruim 300.000 professionals, waarvan duizenden software-engineers. We hebben onze deuren voor elkaar openstaan en delen graag onze kennis. Zo houden we bijvoorbeeld wekelijkse lunchsessies en organiseren we masterclasses. Samen met je career-counselor werk je aan je persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Ook mooi: de vele teambuildingevents binnen de organisatie. Voor young professionals organiseert Young Capgemini daarnaast diverse activiteiten, zoals een obstacle run, barbecue of een weekendje weg.Benieuwd naar het werken als software-engineer? Location: Delft, The NetherlandsDepartment: R&DType of employment: full-timeHMS’ business unit Anybus is looking for a Front-End Developer to join the R&D team in Delft, The Netherlands.We are looking for a person who has an inquisitive mind and who loves building clean, reusable code and enjoys using a wide selection of scripting and markup languages. Someone who is unafraid to make improvements and is willing to accept a leadership role.You need comprehensive knowledge of web techniques such as Angular, Material, HTML5, SCSS and Javascript. This requires a focus on teamwork and meeting goals. Our company’s leading position in the automated industry comes from innovative ideas, quality work, and customer centricity.As part of the R&D team, you’ll soon be developing web-based user interfaces for some of the most recognised solutions in the automation industry, including cool stuff like cybersecurity. The Anybus R&D teams are located at HMS' head office in Halmstad, Sweden and Delft, The Netherlands. The developers, engineers and technical professionals in both countries work closely together. Eye has a mission: to digitally secure SMEs in Europe. This initiative comes from the dream of former intelligence and security service employees in the Netherlands to also protect smaller companies from the increasing threat of cybercrime. We've been doing this since 2020 and are now a team of almost 80 passionate and talented professionals who all have something in common: a strong aversion to (digital) injustice. Are you up for a challenge and joining us?Your role at EyeAs a Front-end Software Engineer at Eye you are part of the team who is redefining the status quo for the Cybersecurity industry SMEs all over Europe come to us to solve their cyber risk. We show them how to optimally reduce their risk exposure, hunt for weaknesses in their systems and adopt a proven and intelligence-led cybersecurity approach. You team up with leading cybersecurity professionals, fellow Python-heads, and best-in-class product owners with the aim of revolutionising the cyber-security space for SMEs. Together, you help build infinitely scalable threat detection solutions, solutions which empower cyber threat analysts to spot and investigate breaches.Key ResponsibilitiesYour scope consists -but not limits itself- to our alerting pipelines, detection automation and will work on the front end of our Customer facing portal and Microservices. Tasks include, but are not limited to:Being curious and willing to understand the development problem you get with your teamWrite clean code in and with React, Javascript & Typescript Discuss your code with colleagues via Merge Requests and review those of your colleagues tooContribute to your teams sprint meetings and the developer meetingsBuilding new features: we’re a startup so the development work is mostly about building new featuresMaintaining our development products, make sure to keep the documentation up to date ;-)Researching new tools, products and techniques. We find it important to work with state-of-the-art technology and invite you to help with thatJoin our Bug Hunt Friday, every month we team up with our Security Experts and dedicate a Friday afternoon to find bugs in software and/or hardware, from ourselves or others. This is a great place to learn more about cybersecurity!Depending on the team where you will work, tasks include:Building customer facing features for our integrated customer portal where we give direct security insights to our customersImproving our automation, so we’ll be able to inform our partners in realtime Building new front end features for our phishing simulation toolchain so we can prepare and train our customers for phishing attack Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

As an IT intern at YourSurprise you will be fully part of the IT team, consisting of around 35 people with expertise in software development, data science, testing and much more. Every day they are working on the core of YourSurprise and improving it little by little. Most colleagues are using techniques like PHP, Typescript and React, which are our main programming languages, however we have colleagues specialised in testing, data science, and setting up our cloud infrastructure as well.What projects do we have?Based on your ambitions you will be placed in one of our IT related ships or assigned a specific project to do research. Some of the projects we have in mind right now are:Finding out whether low code is usable within YourSurprise;Researching AI possibilities within YourSurprise;Developing software used internally by your (new) colleagues,Supporting our personalisation tool, the editor, by developing certain parts of it together with a big team;Predicting whether the production orders will be finished on time with data science models and data analysis.Curious about one of the above projects, or have a great idea yourself? Join us and help us structure the global webAre you a web developer eager to use the latest web techniques in combination with an in-house developed software? Do you believe that products and processes can always be improved no matter how great they are? Then you shouldn’t miss this job opening!What You'll DoWe’re growing fast and our website cannot lag behind. That’s why we’re looking for a junior web developer to help us maintain and optimize our website. You’ll work closely together with the other members of our Integrations team and support them to ensure that our website looks sleek and is always up to date.We’re a dynamic company that encourages everyone’s development. Our team is expanding, so there is a clear path to progression and growth within the company.Who You AreYou thrive in a fast-paced environment and can effectively convert ideas into functional websites. In addition:A degree in IT, computer sciences or communication and multimedia design;Experience with HTML, CSS, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, React;You can think along with us, take the initiative and come up with ideas;You can work well in a team but also independently;Eager to learn and master new skills;You’re available to work 32-40 hours a week;You have an EU passport;You live in the vicinity of Groningen: this isn’t a remote job but we offer the flexibility to work from home some of the time.What We OfferThis is your chance to join a dynamic tech company where you’ll be part of a very ambitious and smart team on a mission to structure the global web. You’ll get all the benefits of working for an agile scale-up such as a relaxed work environment, the possibility to work from home part of the time, easy-going colleagues and freedom in your work.Additionally, We Offer YouA salary based on your skills and experience25 days of paid annual leave*A holiday allowanceA good pension insuranceAn annual budget of €1.200 to spend on professional or personal developmentThe best hardware of your own choice: Apple or LinuxHybrid work model: a mix of working from home and in the officeA lounge room, an in-office pool table and a fully-equipped canteenHealthy and delicious buffet breakfast, lunch and a filled refrigerator in the officeEverything you need to work from home: a screen, keyboard and mouseA budget of €78 for a lease bike: any bike you like, including maintenanceA €50 internet reimbursement*A monthly Thuisbezorgd budget of €50 to enjoy a meal with your colleagues or family*A monthly sports budget of €40 to stay healthy and in shape: get a gym membership or buy a pair of new tennis shoes*A mobile phone and a monthly mobile phone subscription reimbursement of €35*A compensation fee of €2 per day when you work from homeFun events with colleagues: 4 Mijl van Groningen, Startup Weekend Groningen, Thursday Drinks, Board Game Nights, Pub Quizzes, Pizza Knowledge Sessions, Ping-Pong Tournaments and our memorable Dataprovider.com OutingsA referral reward program: refer a friend for one of our jobsbased on a 40-hour contractDataprovider.com transforms the internet into an ever-growing structured databaseThe web is the world’s greatest information source - literally and figuratively. It contains more valuable information than all annual reports and trend analyses rolled into one. However, the web is also the world’s greatest source of information chaos: that’s why it’s difficult to extract qualitative data.Founded in Groningen in 2012, Dataprovider.com has been structuring relevant digital actions into concrete insights that are used worldwide by leading organizations such as PayPal, Statistics Netherlands, United Nations, GoDaddy, Mollie, Takeaway.com and the investment industry. We’re growing fast and we’re always on the lookout for new talent!Our teamOur team consists of a wide range of professionals: data scientists, data support engineers, developers, designers, account managers and the list goes on. Most of the people at Dataprovider.com have been working here for long: they started while they were students and have been an inseparable part of the team ever since. Our slogan is “Work hard, work together and help each other out, always.” When we aren’t working hard, we’re eating ice cream (anytime of the day or year) and playing board games, ping-pong or American pool.Join us and help us structure the global webIf you have any questions about working at Dataprovider.com or about the selection process, don’t hesitate to contact our recruiter Elizabeth for more information.We’ll appreciate it if recruitment agencies don’t respond to this job opening.Our selection process Application If you’re interested in this job opening, click on the Apply button and send us your resume. Coffee If your application is successful, you’ll get invited to an initial meeting or a phone/video call with our recruiter Maaike. You can ask her anything you want to know about the job. Interview In the second interview you will show your knowledge and skills and meet some of the people in the team. Offer Congratulations! We’re making you an offer to join our team and help us structure the global web. Welcome! You’re signing a contract and meeting your colleagues: nice to meet you! Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Are you looking for a challenging and independent position in an international and dynamic company? Do you want to make an impact by implementing the coolest designs that will blow away our customers? Stop the search and join us as Junior Support Web Developer!SKIM is a global insights agency helping leading companies thrive by understanding decision making. To stay ahead today, it’s critical to know how decisions are made and how the changing environment influences decisions for consumers, healthcare and B2B professionals. We combine decision-behavior know-how with analytical rigor, a thorough understanding of marketing challenges, and innovative research techniques. The result? Practical recommendations you can use to propel your business forward, online and offline.Job DescriptionYour role is to take our survey design and functionality to the next level and to create innovative solutions for our clients. We offer a competitive salary & benefits package that includes the following:Annual performance-based and profit sharing bonusRegular team outings and eventsAnnual team-building dayOpen, communicative work environmentHigh value placed on taking initiative and ownershipFlat organizational structureFocus on true work / life balanceGreat passionate colleaguesActive training programs in place, many of which are guided on-the-job trainingAdditional InformationAt SKIM, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. With increased diversity comes greater variety of perspectives, ideas and creativity, and we foster an environment where everyone feels welcome and comfortable to be their authentic selves. Therefore, we welcome diversity in applicants and base our hiring decisions regardless of age, race, color, religion, ethnicity, nationality, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, genetic characteristics, marital or military status.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Thank you for taking the time to read the description of this role, and we look forward to reading your application! As a Junior Software Engineer in their team, you'll have the exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge software and contribute to the final product. Your role will focus on creating innovative solutions to challenges that arise from operational and business needs. This role requires proficiency in Python and is based in Leusden, Utrecht, within a team of 20 employees.The company you'll be working for is an AI start-up, specializing in the automation of vehicle inspections. They have developed a unique gate system that simplifies vehicle inspections, generating highly accurate damage reports in less than ten seconds after a vehicle passes through. This revolutionary gate system not only saves time but significantly reduces costs. After two years of active development, they are ready to implement and install this solution for their customers.As a Junior Software Engineer, you'll collaborate with their software engineering team to ensure the quality of the product. Together, you will develop a vision for the software strategy and play a crucial role in quality assurance. You will be expected to be a highly skilled developer, with a focus on people, quality, and continuous improvement. You'll work hands-on with their software and guide less experienced colleagues.In this role, you'll be part of shaping the company's future. This AI start-up is home to a team of 20 young, bright individuals dedicated to revolutionizing vehicle inspections. You will be joining a team that values hard work, creativity, and the readiness to tackle challenges.The ideal candidate for this role should have proficiency in Python, C++, and English, with a preference for skills in Amazon Web Services (AWS), FastAPI, Continuous Integration & Delivery (CI/CD), and camera/vision systems. A Master's Degree is also preferable.Working for this company comes with a generous allowance of 33 vacation days and a flexible working schedule with three days in the office and two days working from home. They also offer visa sponsorship.The company prides itself on its team of enthusiastic young professionals who work closely together. They value the balance between hard work and having fun, with regular team building events every three months and spontaneous social gatherings. They are currently located in Leusden, but as part of their growth, they are considering relocating to either Utrecht or Amsterdam.Your responsibilities will include improving the code base and developing new software according to the software development standards. The tools used for these tasks include Python, Github, Docker, AWS, TerraForm, and RDS.The company has ambitious growth plans, having doubled their headcount in 2022, with further growth expected in 2023. This expansion offers plenty of opportunities for new colleagues. They are committed to creating a personal growth path to work on your ambitions and goals. While the company operates internationally, the headquarters remain in the Netherlands, offering opportunities for progression to Medior, Senior, or Lead roles. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

description: Het is als bedrijf tegenwoordig van groot belang bij te blijven als het gaat om ontwikkeling op IT gebied. Digitalisering is niet meer een keuze maar een noodzaak geworden om relevant te blijven. Bij dit IT consultancybedrijf weten ze dat je altijd een stap voor moet blijven op je concurrent. Hier staat internet security hoog in het vaandel en werken ze snel doch secuur. Help jij mee aan deze successen te werken?Klinkt leuk, maar waar heb je het over?Er zijn een hoop consultancy bureaus in Nederland, maar er zijn er maar weinig die zelfs in deze rare tijden nog weten te groeien. Dit is er één van. En niet zonder reden. Ze werken namelijk alleen met de beste mensen aan de gaafste projecten.Nu zal je denken, dat heb ik eerder gehoord. Alleen is het dit keer ook echt waar. Het begint bij de eisen die ze stellen aan hun consultants. Iedereen heeft namelijk een Masterdiploma. En het gaat niet alleen om kennis, maar ook om de soft skills die nodig zijn om die kennis toe te passen. Het bedrijfskundige inzicht, de communicatieve vaardigheden en de politieke sensitiviteit die je nodig hebt om anderen te informeren, overtuigen en enthousiasmeren. Hun consultants zijn dan ook echte talenten en stuk-voor-stuk, indrukwekkende professionals.Daarnaast zijn ze niet alleen veeleisend richting hun eigen medewerkers, maar ook richting hun klanten. Van de grootste banken en verzekeraars, tot bouwbedrijven en energiemaatschappijen. Grote bedrijven met nog grotere uitdagingen. Als het niet onwijs complex en haast onmogelijk is, dan doen ze het niet.Interessant, maar wat heb je van mij nodig dan?Binnen de projecten die dit bedrijf voor haar klanten uitvoert is er altijd een uitdaging voor een software engineer zoals jij. Een jonge talentvolle Front-end Developer die alle ins en out betreft Front-end development wil leren. Met de kennis die jij al meebrengt en jouw leergierigheid, ben jij misschien wel de perfecte kandidaat voor deze baan.Dat ben ik inderdaad, maar ik werk niet gratisGelukkig wordt je niet alleen iedere dag uitgedaagd bij dit bedrijf, je wordt ook nog eens goed beloond. Naast een jaarsalaris tot €55.000 bruto ontvang je ook mooie secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een premievrij pensioen en een lease auto. Bovendien ben je er zeker van dat je alleen samenwerkt met de besten in hun vakgebied, van Data Scientists en Developers, tot UX Researchers. Klaar voor de volgende challenge? Klik op Apply, zodat het echte werk kan beginnen. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Do you have at least 3 years of work experience as a Front-end Developer? Are you the best at analyzing problems and debugging those? And are you looking for an employer that values your personal and professional development? Then this position at world heritage preserver Picturae might be for you!Your role As a Front-end Developer at Picturae you will focus on realizing the customer wishes. You will also solve any software problems that may occur. Besides that;you will design websites/applications and translate them to (HTML) templatesyou will use well-known frameworks, libraries and toolsyou will write code according to the coding standardsyou will deliver final products that will surpass the expectations of customersYour profile At Picturae you will work independently, but you are also a big team player. You want to develop yourself. Not only on a professional, but also on a personal level. And you like to make time for that. Besides that:You have experience with JavaScript (ES2017), HTML, CSS/SCSSYou are familiar with front-end unit testing and preferably also familiar with automated testing (CI/CD)You have at least 3 years of work experience as a Front-end DeveloperYou have experience with Vue.js or another modern JavaScript frameworkIs experience with Linked Open Data, SHACL and RDF in combination with JavaScript a plusIs experience with SCRUM/Agile way of working also a plusTo excel in this position, you will need these competences:Accurate and carefulFlexibleGreat ability to learnCommittedStructured and organizational skillsWhat We OfferYou will join a team of professionals who all have a heart for their profession. Our employees are innovative, involved, respectful and driven - and we expect the same from you. In return, of course, you will have an inspiring working environment and plenty of room to develop your talents and qualities. Working at Picturae also means that you can count on the following working conditions;A competitive salary25 (+2 bonus) days of vacationTravel allowanceNon-contributory pension (2/3)Training and development opportunitiesDutch annual museum cardLaptopAnd more!About PicturaeWe believe that you can dream about the future because you have learned from the past. At our headquarters in Heerhugowaard, archives and collections are digitized. In order to be able to preserve them forever. Our own in-house software development team enables us to offer solutions for the online accessibility of our customers' digital collections. In the past 15 years we have successfully helped both national and international organizations with this. And we are proud of that! Examples include Stadsarchief Amsterdam, Smithsonian (USA), Koninklijke Bibliotheek and Heineken.By digitizing history and making it directly accessible, we help the world move forward. Will you take the next step into the future with us?&Work will help youAt &Work we understand that it is important to work in a place where you are valued, where you can develop yourself and where you are given the space to grow. By applying via &Work, you get direct access to our broad network of employers. We can help you with the introduction to the company, provide background information, prepare you for interviews so that you can present yourself convincingly and assist you during the negotiations to allow you to take a nice step forward in your career. Haven't found what you were looking for yet? Sign up via &Work and we'll keep in touch. If we've found something that really suits you, we'll let you know! Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Type vacature: RegulierCity: AmstelveenHours per week: 40Education: HBO Bachelor; HBO Master; HBO Master/ WO-pre-master; WO MasterApply before: 28-05-2023 Introduction A leading edge stack, team members from all over the world, impact on a global scale : it’s the day-to-day life of our digital F ront -end E ngineers. We are dealing with the unique challenge to deliver a multi-branded web app of enterprise scale: our metrics (like amount of visitors and revenue) are expressed in multiple millions. And the good news is: we're looking for a few more talented engineers! As an engineer you will be welcomed in one of our Agile teams where you will join the adventure to reach increasing levels of high performance.We are looking for a developer who has specific interest in information analysis and would like to combine this with engineering. The information analysis consists of analyzing business questions (‘what is the real problem?’) and determining which solution scenarios are applicable. In determining these, the whole IT-landscape and existing designs, technical requirements and impact on business processes and innovation should be taken into account. Therefore good stakeholder management (e.g. business owners, product owners, users, architects, other teams) is key. What are you going to do? You will be working in a challenging Agile scrum environment: very dynamic, complex and diverse, where things can and will change on a day to day basis.You will: help managing day to day releases; improve customer experience, building high end customer features to improve customer satisfaction; work together to keep the standards high; work in close contact with Google Angular core team; be a front runner in Angular stack, always on the latest version; try out new technologies that add value to our product and customer experience. Where do you land? We look forward to welcoming you as a Front-end Engineer in a team of teams together building AFKL front-end with an Agile mindset! In the current circumstances we work from home or in a hybrid form. But when possible, we work lean and mean, with flex working spaces and a ping pong table. Your team consists of highly motivated professionals, from different countries and with different backgrounds, who are pushing the edge with the latest tools. We work together intensively and across boundaries, also together with Air France counter parts in Paris and Valbonne. Your profile You have a great sense of responsibility, you see the bigger picture and do not stop before the customer is 100% happy! You like to take initiative, experiment and use your creativity and analytical ability to come up with the best solutions. Your features are KLM’s digital face to the customer. The compliments are yours for improving proactively! In addition, it is important that you are a team player with good communication skills.Also you have proficient knowledge on: Javascript ES2020-ES2021, TypeScript and Typings; Agile development and Scrum; Angular, GraphQL (Apollo), Node.js, RxJS; DevOps & CI/CD in the Cloud (Azure);More over responsive design, accessibility (WCAG) and automated testing are no-brainers to you;And: you have vision on quality and usability; you are aware of latest trends in your field; you can express your professional opinion well and also listen to the input of others. We offer Ability to use the latest technologies with your creativity to set trends Work in one of world’s leading Front-end teams with people from all across the world A gross salary between € 3.306,23 and € 6.392,07 per month Plenty of room for personal development and wonderful career opportunities A good pension scheme, end of the year bonus and 8 percent holiday pay 25 days of paid holiday and 5 extra days off Great discounts on airline tickets (if you have been in service for at least 6 months) A travel expenses scheme and free use of the bus network around Schiphol A MacBook Pro Discount of your health insurance A personal budget for sustainable employability Ready for your next destination? D on’t wait any longer, send us your CV before the final boarding call! A motivation letter is no longer required; we will simply ask you a couple of questions during your online application. Within two weeks you will receive a message from us. Your application procedure consists of two interviews and a case . Questions? If you would like to know more about the position, please contact the hiring manager. Call or e-mail the recruiter for questions about the application process. In both cases, don't forget to mention the vacancy number: #8026. Hiring manager Sanne Wijnands: SANNE.WIJNANDS@KLM.COM Recruiter Jenna Hoopman: JENNA.HOOPMAN@KLM.COMDetails from this vacancy are not to be used for marketing purposes. Ontwikkelen van betekenisvolle software voor onze maatschappijKom jij ook samen met ons werken aan de Suites voor het Sociaal Domein? Dit is één van de meest gebruikte softwareoplossingen door gemeenten. De Suites voor het Sociaal Domein helpen gemeenten bij het ondersteunen van hun burgers. Specifiek bij het vinden van werk, het verstrekken van uitkeringen en het verstrekken van zorg- of jeugdzorgvoorzieningen.We werken met negen Agile/Scrum teams aan dit prachtige product en zoeken nu voor verschillende teams uitbreiding. Er liggen namelijk grote vernieuwingsplannen klaar. De toekomstige software zal worden ontwikkeld vanuit een zelf ontwikkelde, model-driven architectuur én in .NET/C# ontwikkelde functionaliteit.Het belangrijkste is dat jij blij wordt van het ontwikkelen van software binnen Microsoft omgevingen. Wij zijn op zoek naar iemand die al de nodige ervaring heeft opgedaan met C#, .NET of soortgelijke programmeertalen en omgevingen. We verwachten dat je nieuwsgierig bent naar onze huidige programmatuur en dat je het een uitdaging vindt om die te vernieuwen naar C# en .NET. Uiteraard begeleiden wij jou daarin en nemen wij je mee in onze huidige software. Met deze vernieuwing willen we ook meteen de kwaliteit van onze software verhogen. Daarin mag jij ook meedenken en voorstellen doen. Graag zelfs! Ga met ons in gesprek en op basis van jouw kennis, ervaring en wensen kunnen wij gezamenlijk die werkplek vinden waar jij je het beste thuis zal voelen. Je komt te werken in een Agile/Scrum team samen met andere software developers, testers, een product owner en een scrum master. Centric biedt ruime mogelijkheden voor leren en zelfontwikkeling. Bijvoorbeeld in het opdoen van nieuwe kennis om door te ontwikkelen in je functie (via onze CentricAcademy). Maar ook naar ander werk en andere functies als jij daaraan toe bent.Wat jij meebrengtHbo of wo werk- en denkniveauJe hebt kennis van C#, .NET of soortgelijke programmeertalen en omgevingenJe wilt (net als wij) leren en groeien in je vakWerkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie als softwareontwikkelaar is een préWij werken in Agile teams; dit spreekt je aan en je wilt daar graag in meewerkenWaar jij op kunt rekenenGoede arbeidsvoorwaarden met daarbij een marktconform maandsalaris, reiskostenvergoeding (woon-/werkverkeer), thuiswerkvergoeding en voorzieningen zoals laptop en telefoonFlexibiliteit om je werk in te delenDoorgroeimogelijkheden in diverse richtingenKans je te specialiseren in diverse richtingenKans je te specialiseren door uitgebreide opleidingsmogelijkheden26 vakantiedagenGoede pensioenvoorzieningenKortingen op verzekeringen, reizen, pretparken, kleding, hotelovernachtingen, sportabonnementen, telefoonabonnementen en nog veel meer!De unit waar jij komt te werkenVan uitvoering jeugdwet tot uitkeringsaanvraag, bijna alles wat je als burger met de overheid regelt verloopt via de oplossingen van Centric. Centric is al jarenlang een stabiele partner voor de lokale overheid. Onze gekwalificeerde professionals, technologische oplossingen en ervaring met specifieke brancheprocessen, zorgen ervoor dat overheden zich op hun kerntaken kunnen richten. Samen met onze klanten creëren we duurzame oplossingen die bijdragen aan het behalen van hun doelstellingen. Meer weergeven Minder weergeven

Interested in a job in IT and contributing to a better world? Discover your best self with the Young Professional Program IT.You and your futureDuring the Young Professional Program IT (also known as YPPIT) at Rabobank you work on your career one day a week by following technical training, or you work on your personal development. You develop talents you didn’t know you had and we are given the space to discover for yourself what you are good at and what you like. And then? Everything you learn in the training courses can immediately be put into practice, because the other 4 days you work in your starter position as a Junior RPA Engineer. RPA stands for Robotics Process Automation. Under the guidance of experienced colleagues, you will become a specialist in your field in no time. In addition, in the program you will work together with the team on 2 business challenges on themes such as the cooperative energy transition.Join us in developing and maintaining Robotics and low-code solutions to automate repetitive business processes within the Rabobank. We are an ambitious team with all the advantages of a big and professional department, but the freedom to fill in your own role. Becoming an RPA developer in one of our Robotics Center of Excellence scrum teams is an exciting job with a group of ambitious people. Over the last years, we have automated many processes within the bank with our robotics solutions to make work great again for our people at the Rabobank. You will be part of a vibrant community of engineers and you will work in one of our Scrum teams. You can even develop yourself also in a Product Owner or Scrum Master role within Robotics next to advancing your engineering skills. You might even start in a hybrid form; as a part-time scrum master and Robotics engineer depending on your skills and ambition. If you enjoy building and creating new applications but you don’t want to be hardcore developer, then this is your place to be. We conceptualize, design, build and support automation solutions that are easy to build and maintain and you will feel like a Robotics expert in no time.ExamplesYou will be working together with your scrum team on a project like creating a new application (in RPA in low-code software like PowerApps) which can help the people from the Know Your Client department to do their work faster.Or, you might be working on a robot which will help client advisors of the bank to schedule new appointments with clients more quickly by building a robot that syncs the different calendars of all the people who need to be involved and also suggest the best time to meet with the client. You would then also build the front-end that would facilitate this process and help the advisors in their daily job.2 business challenges within the YPPITPracticalLength: Young Professional Program IT: 18 monthsAfter which you will continue to work with us as an RPA engineerHours per week: 40Your development as a professionalTo become the specialist in your professional field, in the Young Professional Program IT 1 day a week you mainly attend training courses that that support your talent development. The courses are often given by experienced colleagues or trainers with a track record. You build your network, gain valuable experience and develop skills which will be of use to you later in your career.Learning From Each OtherDevelopment is our top priority. Because the best way to learn is by doing, through mistakes and successes. At Rabobank we offer you the right balance between freedom and supervision. To develop talents you never thought you possessed. To specialize in a professional field or explore the things you're good at and enjoy doing. During the Young Professional Program IT you can count on us for excellent supervision. You'll work with experienced colleagues and have lots of contact with young professionals.“Working as an Robotics Engineer is extremely varied and therefore never boring. On one assignment I am building a robot and on another assignment I am developing a power app to support the business in their daily work. That variety in work, the opportunity to develop yourself and also help determine what your next assignment will be, is why this is such a great position. I feel a lot of ownership of my projects and am proud when for example a new robot goes live.” Robotics Engineer Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.You and your talenta bachelor or master degree, or an equivalent working / thinking levelaffinity with and interest in software development, and already some experience with the area of Robotics Process Automationexcellent proficiency in Englishstrong communication skillsfeedback makes you strongerlearns from mistakesadaptive to changing situationsfocus on the solutionThis Is What We Offer YouMost of all, we offer you an 18 month long rich learning experience, while you advance your career towards an expert in your fieldA gross monthly salary in function scale 7A combination of working from home and at the officeA personal development budget of € 1,400-This is a selection of the terms of employment for an Robotics Engineer based on a 40-hour working week.You and the job application processWe believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you.So get in touch straightaway:An assessment is part of the selection process.A security check is part of the process.We respect your privacy.
